title: kageki_(ensemble_stars!)
body: An [[Ensemble Stars!]] (!) event story written by Yuuki Yoshino. It was released on January 15, 2016.

title: aim-9_sidewinder
body:
The AIM-9 Sidewinder (for Air Intercept Missile) is a heat-seeking air-to-air [[missile]] which first entered service with the [[United States Navy]] in 1956 and was adopted by the [[United States Air Force]] in 1964. Since then, the Sidewinder has proved to be an enduring international success, and its latest variants remain standard equipment in most western-aligned air forces. The [[Soviet]] [[K-13 Vympel]], a reverse-engineered copy of the AIM-9, was also widely adopted by a number of nations.

The Sidewinder is the most widely used air-to-air missile in the West, with more than 110,000 missiles produced for the U.S. and 27 other nations, of which perhaps one percent have been used in combat. It has been built under license by some other nations including [[Sweden]], and can even be equipped by [[helicopter]]s, such as the Bell AH-1Z Viper. The AIM-9 is one of the oldest, lowest cost, and most successful [[air-to-air missile]]s, with an estimated 270 [[aircraft]] kills in its history of use. When firing a Sidewinder, NATO pilots use the brevity code "FOX-2".

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: AIM-9 Sidewinder":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AIM-9_Sidewinder]

title: k-13_vympel
body:
Also known by its NATO reporting name, "AA-2 Atoll". A [[Soviet]] heat-seeking [[air-to-air missile]] reverse-engineered from the American [[AIM-9 Sidewinder]], hence it having very similar appearance to the American weapon. Since entering service in 1961, it has been widely exported to and used by the Warsaw Pact and other Communist Bloc nations. 

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: K-13 (missile)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K-13_(missile)]

title: growmon
body:
A Dark Dragon Digimon. Growmon resembles its predecessor, [[Guilmon]], but more savage and violent in appearance. Its hands now possess an outwards facing claw.

It primarily digivolves into [[MegaloGrowmon]]. 

Growmon is known as [b]Growlmon[/b] in English material.

title: aston_machan_(umamusume)
body:
An [[Umamusume]] character. Known for always staring at the camera as if she is staring at the [[Trainer (Umamusume)|]].

The real horse won the Sprinters Stakes at the age of three in 2007. Unfortunately she was affected by Colitis-X and passed away at just four years old while training for the Takamatsunomiya Kinen in 2008.

She is strongly associated with [[Aston Martin]], both the car manufacturer and the [[Formula One]] team.

title: arcubus
body:
A fan made character who represents ([[personification|personifies]]), plays the role of a [[mascot]], or a [[booth babe]] for the fictional company 'Arquebus Corporation' from the game [[armored core vi: fires of rubicon|Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

"Conceived as Arquebus' response":[https://x.com/haruhiapocrypha/status/1704007172408156367?t=Etip7vt5uIPTO-qdruHQBw&s=19] to [[Dafeng Nyan-Nyan]] by [[haruhimagia]], this booth babe is named after a portmanteau of 'Arquebus' and '[[succubus]]'.

title: ve-60sna
body:
[b]VE-60SNA[/b] is a 'stun needle launcher' weapon that appears in [[Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon]].

Developed by Arquebus Advanced Development Division, this [[shoulder cannon|shoulder-mounted launcher]] is given to [[621 (Armored Core Vi)|the player]] to counter [[ice worm (armored core vi)|IA-02: ICE WORM]]'s Coral shield. It fires a massive electrified needle, creating a powerful discharge on contact.

Despite its position similar to [[Storm Ruler (dark souls)|]], it is still a powerful weapon even against other enemies, so much so that it had to be nerfed via updates.

h5. Notable Users
* [[V.II Snail]]'s [[Open Faith (Armored Core Vi)|Open Faith]]

title: mad_comic_dialogue
body:
A since-disbanded four member unit in [[Hypnosis Mic]]. It predates [[The Dirty Dawg]] and began as the joining of [[Aohitsugi Samatoki]] & [[Nurude Sasara]]'s original Mad Comic Dialogue with [[Yamada Ichiro]] & [[Harai Kuko]]'s Naughty Busters.

This tag strictly refers to the four person team and not the original duo that used the MCD name.

title: manlification
body:
When an otherwise normal character (even a small creature such as a [[pokemon (creature)|]]) is drawn with a very imposing, very manly face for comedic effect, often sporting huge muscles.

Characters depicted this way are often drawn in the style of [[manly]] series such as [[Hokuto No Ken]], [[Jojo No Kimyou Na Bouken]] or [[Grappler Baki]], or various specific characters (such as [[Gachimuchi]] actors or [[Broly (Dragon Ball Z)|Dragon Ball Z's Broly]]), with only clothes or hairstyle as a sign of the original character.

Note that a character just being [[genderswap (ftm)|genderswapped]] into a muscular man or having extra muscles is not enough to qualify for this tag: posts falling into this tag must be obvious, outrageous parodies of the original copyright.

h4. Examples

* !post #490560
* !post #1573019
* !post #1573999
* !post #4175324

h4. Incorrect examples

* !post #2519107: Not manly enough
* !post #9299883: Not outrageous enough; just a regular genderswap
* !post #4884329: Female face
* !post #5676317: Animal head

h4. See also

* [[araki hirohiko (style)]] 
* [[hara tetsuo (style)]]

title: regina_(dokidoki!_precure)
body:
[[Dokidoki! Precure]] character. A mysterious girl who first appears briefly in episode 12, then fully introduced in episode 13. She is revealed early on to be [[King Jikochuu]]'s daughter.

[spoilers]In the epilogue light novel, which takes place after the series, Regina fused with [[Madoka Aguri]] with Ai-chan's help, transforming her into her own Pretty Cure form, Cure Joker.[/spoilers]

title: side_basshar
body:
One of [[motorcycle]] from [[Kamen Rider 555]].
It's main rider is [[Kamen Rider Kaixa]].

h4. Forms 
h5. Vehicle mode
This form has the appearance of a [[motorcycle]] with [[sidecar]].
The motorcycle and sidecar can be separated and each can operate separately.

h5. Battle mode
* !post #745859
* !post #995242
This form has the appearance of a bipedal combat vehicle.
Its main weapons are four claws in its right hand and a six-round missile launcher in its left hand.

title: dawnmaker_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
A weapon in [[Honkai: Star Rail]]'s Amphoreus story, a divine sword given to [[Phainon (honkai: Star Rail)|]] by Chartonus. It is a [[greatsword]] with a sunburst-shaped rapier-style hilt. 

For Danbooru tagging purposes, "Dawnmaker" has three variants depending on Phainon's form: the regular version associated with himself, a golden-bladed [[huge weapon|large sword]] associated with [[Phainon (Khaslana) (Honkai: Star Rail)|Khaslana]], and a wavy broken-blade form associated with the [[Flame Reaver Of The Deepest Dark|Flame Reaver]].

title: virtual_boy
body:
A "portable" video game console made by [[Nintendo]] in 1995. The first console capable of displaying true 3D, via parallax. To make the console cheaper, it was only capable of displaying red and black. These and the console's large size (despite being advertised as a "portable" console) led to eye strain and headaches during use.

The Virtual Boy was a commercial failure, selling only 770,000 units before it was discontinued a year later, with a library of only 22 games released for it. A stand accessory in the likeness of the Virtual Boy would be released in tandem with the system's addition to the [[Nintendo Switch]]'s Nintendo Classics service.

h4. Examples

* !post #2823801

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Virtual Boy":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_Boy
* "TV Tropes: Virtual Boy":https://tvtropes.org/pmwiki/pmwiki.php/Platform/VirtualBoy

title: chun-li
body:
[b]Chun-Li[/b] (Traditional: 春麗. Simplified: 春丽) is a character in the [[Street Fighter]] series by [[Capcom]]. She is the first female playable character to appear in a 1-on-1 fighting game.

Introduced in [[Street Fighter II (series)|]], Chun-Li was the youngest member of the roster and only female character in the game, the self-proclaimed "strongest woman in the world," and while not as physically powerful as the other characters, she was by far the quickest. Her most famous attack is the [i]Hyakuretsukyaku[/i] ("Hundred Crack Legs", alternately known as "Lightning Legs"), where she repeatedly kicks her opponent from a tilted standing position with incredible speed.

In the Street Fighter series, Chun-Li was an Interpol investigator from [[China]] who had been searching for clues to the recent death of her father. Getting into a friendly spar with an old teacher of hers and friend of her father, [[Gen (street fighter)|]], he gives her a lead into who may have killed her father—the mysterious crime syndicate Shadaloo and its tyrannical leader [[M. Bison]]. After an encounter where M. Bison confirms he slew her father, a tearful Chun-Li swore vengeance and made it her life's mission to destroy Shadaloo and bring M. Bison to justice. She collaborated closely with [[Guile]], [[Cammy White]], [[Ryu (Street Fighter)|]], and the other World Warriors throughout the journey.

After M. Bison's supposedly final death during [[Street Fighter V]], her mission complete, Chun-Li retired from Interpol and opened an orphanage to live a quieter life. The most famous of her young wards - practically her adopted daughter - is [[Li-Fen]].

Chun-Li is one of Capcom's most popular characters and one of the most important females in video game history, appearing in numerous cross-overs and promotions. Her oldest and arguably greatest cross-company rival is [[SNK]]'s [[Fatal Fury]]'s [[Shiranui Mai|Mai Shiranui]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #4060584: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]]
* !post #1291111: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]]
* !post #487373: [[Street Fighter III (series)|]]
* !post #309867: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #5402417: [[Street Fighter 6]]
* !post #4290021: Athlete Chun-Li ([[Street Fighter: Duel]])


Her first design was based on another character from Capcom called [[Tong Pooh]].

She has [[brown eyes]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]] or [[black hair]] almost always done up in a [[double bun]].

Standard costume consists of a [[blue dress|blue]] [[china dress]] with [[puffy short sleeves]] and a white [[sash]], two high [[side slit]]s forming a [[pelvic curtain]], [[brown pantyhose]], [[white boots|white]] [[lace-up boots]], [[spiked bracelet]]s, and [[hair pulled back]] in [[double bun|buns]] under white [[bun cover]]s. She usually wears [[earrings]].

In [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]], she wears a blue, sleeveless [[unitard]] and vest with sneakers and studded bracelets. [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]] & [[Street Fighter V]] introduced skimpier [[official alternate costume]]s, such as her [[backless dress]]; while [[Street Fighter 6]] gave her a [[multicolored dress|white/blue qipao]] & [[blue leggings]].

h4. Known moves

* [[Hyakuretsukyaku]] (百裂脚)
** Senretsukyaku
** Hou Yoku Sen (鳳翼扇)
** Hosenka
* [[Kikouken]] (続気拳)
** Kikoushou (続気掌)
* [[Spinning Bird Kick]] (回鳥脚)
* Hazanshu
* [[Kakukyakuraku]]

h4. See also

* [[Blue Phoenix Ranger]]
* [[EVO moment #37]]
* [[Akiman pose]]

title: takao_(azur_lane)
body:
The nameship of the Takao-class as represented in [[Azur Lane]]. Her censored name is "獒"("Mastiff").

She wears a white [[military uniform]] with a white [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]] and [[black pantyhose]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] worn in a [[ponytail]]. Like most of the Sakura Empire ships, she has [[animal ears]]. In her case, [[dog ears]] folded down to resemble hair flaps (contrast to [[Atago (azur lane)|]]'serect ears). Because they blend almost perfectly with her hair, they are often omitted by fan artists or transformed into actual [[hair flaps]] or [[hair ears]].

She is often paired with her sister Takao, and like her sister she has [[large breasts]].

Voiced by [[Kakuma Ai]].

title: dagger_(marvel)
body:
Tandy Bowen, known alongside her partner as "[[Cloak (Marvel)|Cloak]] & Dagger", is a superhero appearing in [[Marvel]] comic books. They debuted as a duo in [i][[Peter Parker]], the Spectacular [[Spider-Man]] #64[/i], published in 1982.

A teenage girl with rich parents, she was neglected by her mother, and a breakup with an older college student left her despondent, causing her to run away from home.

She meets Tyrone after he prevents a thief from stealing her purse. They quickly become friends. Shortly thereafter, they're abducted by the Maggia and used as guinea pigs for designer drugs. Tandy, Tyrone, and a Chinese immigrant (later retconned to be [[Mr. Negative]]) were the sole survivors. The pair eventually escapes and discovers that the drugs have granted them powers.

Cloak can teleport and turn intangible through the darkforce. Dagger can create daggers and heal through the lightforce. They draw power from one another, further strengthening their newfound bond.

They are closely associated with one another, but given the nature of image boards, you are more likely to see artwork of Dagger without Cloak than Cloak without Dagger.

h4. Appearance

title: cloak_(marvel)
body:
Tyrone "Ty" Johnson, known alongside his partner as "Cloak & [[Dagger (Marvel)|Dagger]]", is a superhero appearing in [[Marvel]] comic books. They debuted as a duo in [i][[Peter Parker]], the Spectacular [[Spider-Man]] #64[/i], published in 1982.

A teenage boy with struggling parents, he struggles with a speech impediment, which prevented him from saving a friend that was unjustly shot by police, assuming he had robbed a store. Tyrone ran from home in distress. 

He considered stealing Tandy's purse to get by, but instead prevented a thief from doing it. He and Tandy quickly become friends. Shortly thereafter, they're abducted by the Maggia and used as guinea pigs for designer drugs. Tandy, Tyrone, and a Chinese immigrant (later retconned to be [[Mr. Negative]]) were the sole survivors. The pair eventually escapes and discovers that the drugs have granted them powers.

Cloak can teleport and turn intangible through the darkforce. Dagger can create daggers and heal through the lightforce. They draw power from one another, further strengthening their newfound bond.

They are closely associated with one another, but given the nature of image boards, you are more likely to see artwork of Dagger without Cloak than Cloak without Dagger.

title: thanos
body:
A supervillain appearing in American comic books published by [[marvel|Marvel Comics]]. Created by writer-artist Jim Starlin, the character first appeared in The Invincible [[Iron Man]] #55 (cover date February 1973).

An Eternal–Deviant warlord from the moon Titan, Thanos is regarded as one of the most powerful beings in the Marvel Universe. He has clashed with many heroes including the [[avengers (series)|Avengers]], the [[Guardians of the Galaxy]], the [[Fantastic Four]], and the [[X-Men]].

Traditionally depicted as a power-hungry tyrant who wields the [[Infinity Gauntlet]] as his signature weapon. He was recharacterized in his [[Marvel|Marvel Cinematic Universe]] incarnation as a tragic villain who wanted to erase half of the universe's population in order to "save" it from its eventual destruction from resource shortage.

In the MCU, the character was first played by Damion Poitier in the film [[The Avengers (2012)]] and then by Josh Brolin in Guardians of the Galaxy (2014), [[Avengers: Age of Ultron]] (2015), [[Avengers: Infinity War]] (2018), [[Avengers: Endgame]] (2019), and the first season of the animated series [[What If...? (disney+)|]] (2021).

super-skrull
body:
The [b]Super-Skrull[/b] is a character in the [[Marvel]] Comics universe created by [[Stan Lee]] and Jack Kirby. He was introduced in [[Fantastic Four]] #18 (September 1963).

Born Kl'rt, he's a decorated soldier from the Skrull world of Tarnax IV, which was destroyed by [[Galactus]]. He was chosen by Skrull Emperor  Dorrek VII to undergo a bioengineering experiment to gain the combined powers of the Fantastic Four, a trait he is best known for.

The experiment granted him pyrokinesis more potant than [[Johnny Storm|The Human Torch]], greater proficiency in invisibility and force field generation than [[Sue Storm|Invisible Woman]], further reach than [[Reed Richards|Mr. Fantastic]], and more strength than [[Ben Grimm|The Thing]].

He is often depicted as an enemy of the Fantastic Four, or an anti-hero.

title: e.g.o_(project_moon)
body:
E.G.O equipment (Extermination of Geometrical Origin) is a recurring theme in [[Project Moon]] media. They can be used by characters in order to enhance their fighting prowess. They can take the form of weapons, clothing, and items.

E.G.O may manifest in two manners:

* Extracted from abnormalities (taking a similar appearance from them)
* Manifested through intense feelings and determination

Notable E.G.O equipment includes [[Gebura (project moon)|]]'s Mimicry (E.G.O extracted from the abnormality [[Nothing There]]) and armor (her own manifested E.G.O).

Prolonged usage of extracted E.G.O one is not fully qualified to use or with low levels of sanity can result in E.G.O corrosion. This results in the user transforming into a form similar to the abnormality the E.G.O was originally extracted from.
h4. See also

* [[Distortion (project moon)|]]
* [[Official alternate costume]]
* [[List of Project Moon characters]]

title: dragon's_crown
body:
A 2-D Multiplayer Real-Time Action Role-Playing video game released in 2013 for [[PlayStation 3]] and [[PlayStation Vita]]. Published by Ignition Entertainment, it is considered a spiritual successor to previous games by the developer, [[Vanillaware]] (headed by founder and lead artist [[Kamitani George]]), including [[Princess Crown]], [[Odin Sphere]], and [[Oboro Muramasa]].

Remarkable due to how much fanart the game spawned despite not being released for several years after character art was posted.

title: niconico
body:
Niconico (ニコニコ) is a popular Japanese video sharing site. The site is sometimes still known by its old name, Niconico Douga (ニコニコ動画, [i]Niconico Video[/i]), and similarly so still believed to require registration to watch any videos onsite, when access has been loosened up over the years.

Niconico has several sister sites:

* Niconico Seiga (ニコニコ静画, [i]Niconico Imageboard[/i]), an imageboard. There was a NSFW section called Niconico Shunga (ニコニコ春画), but this was shut down on January 29th 2025. Seiga has since blocked all access from outside Japan. To access the site, use a VPN or set your browser's User-Agent to Googlebot. 
* Niconico Nama Hosou (ニコニコ生放送, [i]Niconico Live Streaming[/i]), a livestreaming service. Often abbreviated as ニコ生 or ニコなま.
* Nicopedia (ニコニコ大百科), a wiki system. Each article also has a [[2channel]]-like [[oekaki]] board.

A unique feature of Nicovideo is that user comments are displayed as a scrolling feed over the video. See [[Danmaku comments]].

Niconico's mascot character is called "Niconico TV-chan (ニコニコテレビちゃん)":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/695104 (tagged here as [[Terebi-chan]]).

This tag is used for posts referencing the site itself, and locations associated with the site (such as the old [[niconico headquarters (harajuku)|Harajuku HQ]]), as well as for various Niconico(-adjacent) characters that have gained some fanart.

h4. See also

* [[AcFun]]
* [[Bilibili]] (A Chinese video site with similar style)
* [[Danmaku comments]]
* [[2024 niconico cyberattack]]
* [[Niconico Chokaigi]]
** [[Chou Eshi Ten ~IF no Gakkyoku Sekai Ten~]]

title: 2024_pokemon_teraleak
body:
On 13 October 2024, Game Freak suffered a leak which revealed over a terabyte of data and information about [[Pokemon|Pokémon]].

The contents of the leak that are relevant to Danbooru include:
* Several [[prototype design]]s for [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]] from [[pokemon rse|RSE]] to [[pokemon bw|BW]].
* "Mythologically-themed stories":[https://tcrf.net/Development:Pok%C3%A9mon_Diamond_and_Pearl/Documents] which feature [[pokephilia|relations between humans and Pokémon]], including [[Octillery]], [[Typhlosion]], and [[Slaking]].
* Profiles for several NPCs, notably referring to [[Skyla (pokemon)|]] as a "sexy pilot" and Hispanic.

title: warabbit

It is an anthropomorphic [[rabbit]]-like creature carrying an [[innertube]]. It was leaked in the [[2024 Pokemon teraleak|2024 Pokémon teraleak]].

title: ikezawa_hanako
body:
[[katawa_shoujo|Katawa Shoujo]] character.

Hanako is a student at Yamaku High School. Her dark [[purple hair]] hangs down across the right side of her face, hiding significant [[scar|scarring]]. She is incredibly shy and has difficulty opening up to anyone except [[satou lilly|Lilly]], who is blind. 

Hanako is one of [[nakai hisao|Hisao's]] classmates, but is frequently absent, preferring to spend time reading in the library.

title: get_good_(meme)
body:
Said half-sarcastically to someone playing a [[video game]] and complaining that it's too hard. May occasionally appear with respect to other challenging, skill-based activities. Frequently spelled and pronounced as "Git Gud".

Notably, in the game [[Hollow Knight]] the character [[Hornet_(Hollow Knight)|]] seems to say this to the [[knight_(hollow_knight)|player character]], in a certain pivotal scene, despite all other voice lines in the game being in an invented, unintelligible language. While likely just a coincidence, this has greatly contributed to the prominence of this meme in the Hollow Knight community and, in general, the wider indie Metroidvania community.

h4. See Also
* [[skill issue (meme)|]]

title: china_dress
body:
A form-fitting, Chinese [[dress]] that has [[side slit]]s up (usually) both legs and a [[mandarin collar]]. 

The traditional China dress, more properly called a [i]cheongsam[/i] (Cantonese) or [i]qipao[/i] (Mandarin), was introduced in Qing-era China in the 1600s but did not evolve into its current form until the early 20th century. There are many styles, but it typically is a long, form-fitting dress with a [[mandarin collar]], an asymmetric left-over-right opening, high-to-medium [[side slit]]s, and embellished with Chinese [[pankou|frog fasteners]] on the lapel and the collar. It may have any variety of sleeves. 

In anime they are often stylized to be more [[revealing clothes|revealing]] than the traditional dress, being either very short, or having very long [[side slit]]s with a [[pelvic curtain]] that barely covers anything, or having [[cleavage cutout|cleavage]] or [[back cutout]]s.

Don't use this tag for qipao-styled clothes that aren't dresses, such as shirts or vests. Use [[Chinese clothes]] instead. For example, [[Hong Meiling]]'s default outfit is not a dress.

There are various types of neckline in qipao. The most common type is the [[Shanghai neckline]], which has an asymmetrical closure with frogs leading diagonally up to the collar. The [b]Beijing[/b]-style collar is a simpler symmetrical design, with a frog closure directly beneath the collar. The [b]Jiangnan[/b] style is similar to the Beijing style, but features a [[clothing cutout|cutout]] right underneath the collar. 

h4. Examples

* !post #8066966: Traditional qipao
* !post #5767135: Modern qipao
* !post #3903700: Short qipao
* !post #6642639: Qipao with extremely [[highleg]] side slits
* !post #6051354: Revealing qipao

h6. Necklines

* !post #6694692: [[Shanghai neckline]]
* !post #4779076: Beijing neckline
* !post #6709972: Jiangnan neckline

h4. See also

* [[Changpao]]
* [[Chinese clothes]]
* [[Deel]]
* [[Tangzhuang]]
* [[Ao dai]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Qipao":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Qipao]

title: asmoday_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character from [[Genshin Impact]]. She is the Ruler of Space among the Four Shades of the Heavenly Principles.
 
She is the mysterious god responsible for separating the Traveler from their sibling at the start of the game and appears in the opening cutscene, where [[Paimon (genshin impact)|]] refers to her as "Unknown God".

Asmoday is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], [[yellow eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[pale skin]]. Her outfit is an elaborate [[white bodysuit]] plus [[brown gloves]] that meld into her skin, and she closely resembles [[Kiana Kaslana]]'s [[Kiana Kaslana (Herrscher of the Void)|Herrscher of the Void]] battlesuit from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]], even sharing the same Chinese and Japanese voice actresses.

Voiced by Christie Cate in English, [[Kugimiya Rie]] in Japanese and [[Tao Dian]] in Chinese.

h4. See also

title: i_hate_kids_with_good_instincts_like_you_(meme)
body:
An infamous scene from [[Fullmetal Alchemist]] where [[Edward Elric]] confronts [[Shou Tucker]] after realizing the latter performed alchemy [spoiler]on [[Nina Tucker|his daughter Nina]] and [[Alexander_(fma)|his dog Alexander]][/spoiler] to create a [[shou tucker's chimera|chimera]].

The scene is best remembered for Tucker's half-angry, half-cynical expression and his reply to Edward: "I hate kids with good instincts like you." In some localizations, the word "kids" were switched into "brats" instead.

References to this scene will often include a character in the Edward role inquiring about the whereabouts of other characters and the dates of past events. The character in the Tucker role will usually reply something to the effect of, "I hate [X] with good instincts like you."
other_names: 君のような勘のいいガキは嫌いだよ

title: stussy
body:
Stüssy (/ˈstuːsi/) is an American privately held fashion house founded in the early 1980s by Shawn Stussy. It benefited from the surfwear trend originating in Orange County, California, but was later adopted by the skateboard and hip hop scenes.

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/St%C3%BCssy

title: nissin_cup_noodle
body:
[b]Cup Noodle[/b] (known as "Cup Noodles" outside Japan, or colloquially "Nissin Cup Noodle"/"Nissin Cup Noodles" to distinguish it from other noodle brands) is a brand of cup noodles by [[Nissin]].

This tag is specifically used for the Nissin line of cup noodle/ramen products (including classic, chili tomato, seafood, shio, curry, miso, "mystery meat":[https://soranews24.com/2017/09/20/the-true-identity-of-cup-noodles-mystery-meat/], tom yum goong, spicy, etc., featuring their big/mini versions, rich versions, variants, such as cheese curry, Hokkaido milk seafood or negi shio, or international exclusive types if they exist), or [[brand name imitation|imitations]] of their packaging. Only tag [[cup ramen]] if other cup noodle brands are present.

h4. Flavors

* !asset #26843500: Various Japanese flavors
* !asset #26843456: Original
* !asset #26843450: [[nissin cup noodle seafood|Seafood]]
* !asset #26843451: [[nissin cup noodle curry|Curry]]
* !asset #30444892: [[nissin cup noodle cheese curry|Cheese Curry]] 
* !asset #30443948: [[nissin cup noodle chili tomato|Chili Tomato]]
* !asset #30495920: [[nissin cup noodle sio|Sio]] 
* !asset #30525367: [[nissin soup noodle|Soup Noodle]]

h4. See also

title: nissin_cup_noodle_sio
body:
Western-style shio (salt) ramen flavored [[Nissin Cup Noodle]], sold from 2003 to 2023. The original Sio flavor was "introduced":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/595/] in 2003, following the 'Yoshoku Sio' concept of featuring olive oil and basil.

From 2007 to 2019, the 'Yoshoku Sio' concept would be iterated upon further, as packaging began to highlight it more prominently. The "iteration":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/1164/] between 2007 and 2012 was Italian-themed, being 'Arrio Orio'-based and featuring garlic, the "iteration":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/2593/] between 2012 and 2016 was 'herb roasted chicken'-based, introducing pieces of chicken while highlighting the olive oil on the packaging, and the "iteration":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/5214/] from 2016 to 2019 would start highlighting the basil as well. In 2019, it was "rebranded":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/7688/] to SMOKY & SPICY SIO, maintaining the 'Yoshoku Sio' concept, with a new smoked olive oil and black pepper focus.

In 2023, the 'Yoshoku Sio' concept would finally be retired, with the "rebrand":[https://www.nissin.com/jp/company/news/11265/] to the Japanese-style Negi Shio.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #30495920: Original (2003 to 2007)

title: moona_hoshinova
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive Indonesia|hololive ID]]'s [[Area 15|1st generation]]. Moona (unwillingly nicknamed "Moonaroh", which she hates). Designed by [[Nyori]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[starry hair|starry]] [[purple hair]] with [[blonde_hair|blonde]] [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[colored inner hair]]. Her eyes also have a [[purple eyes|purple]] to [[yellow eyes|yellow]] [[gradient eyes|gradient]] and are constantly [[jitome]].

On February 22, 2022 (WIB/JST), Moona reached 1 Million subscribers, being the first hololive Indonesia member as well as Southeast Asian VTuber to reach the milestone.

title: jesus
body:
Jesus of Nazareth (Christ is a title meaning "messiah", not his surname) is the central figure of the Abrahamic religion of [[Christianity]] and believed to be part of the Holy Trinity ([[Yahweh|Father]], Son, Holy Spirit). Adherents of Christianity believe Jesus was the 'begotten Son of God' who became man, [[crucifixion|sacrificed himself on the cross]] to 'cleanse' mankind of its sins, was resurrected from the dead after three days, and ascended into Heaven. Some [[Mormonism|Mormons]] (a nontrinitarian restorationist sect) even believe that the ancient [[Aztec]] god [[Quetzalcoatl (mythology)|]] was historically Jesus Christ, who visited America in ancient times.

This belief in Jesus' divinity is the major difference between Christianity and the other Abrahamic religions: [[Judaism]] believes him, at best, to be a rabbi (generally meaning "teacher"), while [[Islam]] believes him to be a prophet sent by God, but explicitly do not believe Jesus to be a divine figure.

Certain anime and manga series occasionally add their own interpretations of Jesus. One such example closest to [[the Bible]] is [[Steel Ball Run]], but mostly based on Mormon interpretations.

h4. Notable depictions of Jesus

* !post #7025080: "The Christ Pantocrator":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christ_Pantocrator_(Sinai)
* !asset #24783018: [[The Last Supper]]
* !asset #24783003: [[Lost Lamb]]
* !asset #23438446: [[He Lives (simon dewey)|]]
* !asset #24783036: [[Potato Jesus (meme)|]]

h4. See also 

* [[Buddha]] 
* [[Buddy Christ]]
* [[Saint Onii-san]] 
* [[Ecce Homo]]
* [[Steel Ball Run]]

title: the_weaker_sex_1_(gibson)
body:
A 1903 illustration by Charles Dana Gibson, depicting a man torn between two women and violently swinging his head in both directions. In 1910, Lake Forest University would publish the Forester, a yearbook which features a plagiarized copy of the illustration entitled "Which Girl?", "With Apologies to C. D. Gibson" written underneath. The Forester's rendition of the illustration went viral on Japanese Twitter in early 2024, lending the [[meme]] its name in the West.

h4. Examples

* !asset #32477262: The Weaker Sex 1
* !asset #32477318: Which Girl?

h4. External links

* "Internet Archive: The original art":[https://archive.org/details/gibsonbookcollec02gibs/page/n121/mode/1up] and "the Forester rendition":[https://archive.org/details/forester13lake/page/124/mode/1up]
* "Twitter: The viral tweet (by Dilletantegenet)":[https://twitter.com/DilettanteGenet/status/1753000432254013486] ("archived":[https://archive.is/PEWAW])
* "Know Your Meme: The Forester 'Which Girl?'":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/the-forester-which-girl]
other_names: どっちの女の子にするか迷っている110年前の絵

title: afterimage
body:
The effect of a moving object still being visible after having moved. In art, this is used to illustrate motion by showing multiple copies of an object at different points in time.

This is similar to [[motion blur]], except the object is not necessarily blurry.

h4. Examples

* !post #6070195: Hands moving
* !post #9057471: Head nodding
* !post #5467048: Fox jumping

title: knight_a
body:
A five-member (initially six-member) group of [[utaite]]s, ASMR streamers, and game commentators under STPR Inc. Aside from their online activities, Knight A has also done one-man lives and has released merchandise to commemorate all their lives.

[[Mahito (utaite)|]] and [[Soma (utaite)|]] then graduated in 2024 and 2025 respectively. Knight A went on with three members until May 17th, 2025, when they rebranded as [b]Knight X[/b] - with the addition of [[Takeyaki Shou]].

title: haitaka_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Haitaka[/b] is a recruitable boss character from [[Fire Emblem Fates]].

He exclusively appears as Chapter 8's boss on the [i]Conquest[/i] route, where he can be captured and persuaded. As [i]Conquest[/i]'s only Spear Fighter character, Haitaka is one of the most useful units in the entire game despite being a 'generic' unit, this due to the plethora of skills that only he learns in this specific campaign.

title: missing_texture_(source)
body:
Magenta and black checkered patterns that are used when a texture cannot be located for a map or entity in [[Valve Software]]'s Source Engine.

h4. See also
* [[Himekaidou Hatate]] 
* [[error.mdl]]

title: error.mdl
body:
[b]error.mdl[/b] refers to a red 3D error sign used in [[Valve Software]]'s Source Engine as a placeholder for missing model files. Over the years the model has gained relevance in pop culture, alongside the pink and black checkered placeholder pattern that the engine uses for missing texture files.

h4. See also
* [[error message]] 
* [[missing texture (source)]]

title: himekaidou_hatate
body:
The "Modern-Day Spirit Photographer". One of the two playable characters of [[Touhou]]'s [[Double Spoiler]].

A tengu with the power of long-range spirit photography using a [[flip phone]]-like device, thus ridding her of the need to go outside, and rival of fellow tengu/journalist/protagonist [[Shameimaru Aya]]. Like Aya, she also circulates her own newspaper, [[Kakashi Spirit News]]. A common pun is replacing the は in her name with ほ, for Hotate: [[scallop]], then depicting her as one. 

h4. Appearance 
* !asset #23585114

She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair|brown]] [[twintails]] tied with [[purple bow|purple]] [[hair bow|bows]], a [[purple hat|purple]] [[tokin hat]], [[brown eyes|brown]] or [[purple eyes]], and occasionally [[black wings|black]] [[feathered wings]]. She wears a [[short sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[white shirt]] with a [[frilled shirt collar|frilled]] [[collared shirt|collar]], a [[black necktie]], a [[purple skirt|purple]] and [[black skirt|black]] [[checkered skirt]] (noted to resemble a [[missing texture (source)]]), [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]], and either [[brown footwear|brown]] [[geta]] or [[loafers]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Hata-tan (rui (hershe))|Hata-tan]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Hatate Himekaidou":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Hatate_Himekaidou

title: fine_motion_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character, voiced by [[Hashimoto Chinami (voice Actor)|]]. An exchange student from Ireland who comes from a distinguished family. Loves [[ramen]].

Unlike all the other [[horse girl]]s, Fine Motion has completely symmetrical [[hair ornament]]s. These consist of four [[clover hair ornament|clover-shaped hair ornaments]] (three-leaved clovers, each colored in red and outlined in green) arranged in two identical pairs on top of her head, with one pair of clovers each in front of both her left and right ears.

Fine Motion's real-life counterpart is widely rumored to be intersex (appears to be a mare but has male chromosomes and testes). Note that otherwise, she would be treated as a "filly/mare" character (wears [[buruma]] with her [[gym uniform]] and the such) as the original horse ran as one.

h4. Appearance

* !post #3076133: [[Tracen School Uniform]]

h4. Related characters

title: umapyoi_densetsu
body:
A cover song from [[Umamusume]], which has been [[parody|parodied]] for various poses from the [[idol]] performance.

This tag is generally used for when characters are dancing or singing along to the song. Common identifiable poses including raising both arms with hands pointing forwards and slightly down as though imitating a horse's ears (or a horse rearing up), and [[blowing kiss|blowing a kiss]] with both hands. The first pose is associated with the line "Uuuu (Umapyoi Umapyoi)" (parentheses exactly as written) and the second with "Today the Goddess of Victory grants a kiss only to me".

Don't use this tag for when "[[umapyoi (phrase)]]" is used as a slang phrase within normal conversation (that is, the characters are neither singing nor dancing nor posing).

title: catcher_(baseball)
body:
A defensive position in [[baseball]]. The catcher crouches behind the home plate to receive the balls thrown by the [[pitching|pitcher]]. The role of the catcher is to communicate with the pitcher in order to strike the batter out, secure the home plate from runners, and generally coordinate defensive plays. 

Due to the physical demands of the role, catchers wear extra protective equipment that other positions do not require. These include the [[catcher's mask]], the [[chest protector]], and [[shin guards]].

title: rocks_d._xebec
body:
A character from the backstory of the manga and anime [[One Piece]]. He was not only powerful enough to win the allegiance of mighty pirates such as [[Edward Newgate|Whitebeard]], [[Charlotte Linlin|Big Mom]], [[Kaidou (One Piece)|]] and others, he even took on the World Government itself, including invading the [spoiler]Room of Flowers (where [[Imu (one Piece)|]], the secret ruler of the One Piece world, resides)[/spoiler].
He is the father of a pirate almost as infamous as himself, [spoiler][[Marshall D. Teach|Blackbeard]][/spoiler].
Xebec was born as [spoiler]Davy D. Xebec[/spoiler], making him part of the [spoiler]Davy family[/spoiler], whose most famous member and possible founder was [spoiler]Davy. D Jones[/spoiler].

title: help:tags
body:
Tags are keywords used to describe [[help:posts|posts]], allowing you to easily search and explore posts based on their content. Consult the [[help:cheatsheet|cheat sheet]] for a full guide on searching posts. See the [[tag groups]] for existing tags.

h4. Tagging guidelines

When you're tagging a post, use the following guidelines:

h6. Replace spaces with underscores

For example, [code]maria-sama ga miteru[/code] becomes [code]maria-sama_ga_miteru[/code]. Spaces are used to separate tags.

h6. Character names

This is somewhat complicated. In general, use whatever order the source material uses. Failing this, use the ordering the character's nationality suggests. This typically means LastName FirstName order for Asian names, and FirstName LastName order for Western names (except for Hungarians in many cases)

But there are exceptions. Some characters use FirstName LastName order despite having Asian-sounding names. [[Subaru Nakajima]] is a good example of this (in all official promotional artwork FirstName LastName order is used). There is nothing we can do but shake our heads.

Some characters have a mixture of Asian and Western names. Refer to the source material for these cases. Failing that, the general rule is, use whatever ordering the character's last name suggests. Asuka Langley Souryuu has a Japanese last name, so it would become [[Souryuu Asuka Langley]]. Akira Ferrari has an Italian last name, so it becomes [[Akira Ferrari]]. But again, there are exceptions to this, like [[Setsuna F. Seiei]].

h6. Full Names

Using full names reduces the chances of collisions.

h6#restrictions. Tag name restrictions

* Must not be blank, i.e. must contain at least one character
* Cannot contain any asterisks ( * ) or commas ( , )
* Cannot begin with a tilde ( ~ ) or dash ( - )
* Cannot begin or end with an underscore ( _ ), or contain consecutive underscores
* Must contain only printable characters
** [code]!"#$%&'()+-./0123456789:;<=>?@ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ[\]^_`abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz{|}~[/code]
* Cannot begin with a metatag and ":"
** Example: [code]pool:test[/code]
** See "List of available metatags":[/wiki_pages/help:cheatsheet.html#dtext-n4]
* "new" and "search" are reserved and cannot be used
* [b]*_(cosplay)[/b] tags must have an existing character tag
** E.g. [b]chen_(cosplay)[/b] must have a [b]chen[/b] tag

h6. Ask

If you're not sure whether a tag is right or wrong, then ask for help in topic #12251 ("How do I tag this?").

h4. Tag categories

There are five types of tags: artist, character, copyright, general, and meta. Artist tags are red, characters are green, copyrights are purple, general tags are blue, and meta tags are orange.

h6. Artist

Artist tags identify the creator of a post. This doesn't mean the creator of the original copyrighted artwork. For example, you wouldn't use the [[Barasui]] tag on a picture of [[Matsuoka Miu]] drawn by [[Naruko Hanaharu]].

Artist names should follow the guidelines in [[howto:romanize]]. Ask in topic #8199 ("Artist tagging help") if you need help creating an artist tag.

h6. Character

Character tags identify the characters in the post. Remember that Danbooru uses LastName_FirstName ordering.

h6. Copyright

Copyright tags identify the anime, manga, game, or novel that the post is associated with. More generally, copyright tags identify the source material that the characters are from.

Copyright tags should not be used for trademarks or brand names. A rule of thumb: if something doesn't have characters, it probably shouldn't be a copyright tag.

h6. [[help:metatags|Meta]]

Meta tags generally describe things beyond the content of the image itself. Examples include [[translated]], [[copyright request]], [[duplicate]], [[image sample]], and [[bad id]].

h6. General

General tags are used for everything else. General tags should objectively describe the contents of the post. Don't use [[tag group:subjective|subjective tags]] which can be biased by personal preferences (e.g. [[cute]] or [[sexy]]), and don't tag things based on outside knowledge rather than what one can see in the post.

h6#changing-tag-categories. Changing tag categories

You can change the category of the tag by prefixing it with [code]artist:[/code], [code]character:[/code], [code]copyright:[/code], [code]meta:[/code], or [code]general:[/code] when tagging a post. For example, tagging a post with [code]artist:sakura[/code] would change the [[sakura]] tag to an artist tag.

 [code]art:[/code], [code]char:[/code], [code]copy:[/code] are shortcuts for these prefixes.

You can also search the "Tags":[/tags] listing and use the "edit" link next to the tag to change its category.

Tags with between 50 and 1000 posts can only have their category changed by Builders. Category changes for above 1000 posts can be done by Admins, though any large changes should be discussed on the forum first. Make a "bulk update request":/bulk_update_requests/new to create a forum topic requesting that a tag category be changed.

h4. See also

* [[howto:tag|How to Tag]]
* [[help:translated_tags|]]
* [[help:tag_aliases]]
* [[help:tag_implications]]
* [[howto:tag_checklist|Tag Checklist]]

title: bathing
body:
The act of [[washing]] the body in a [[bath]], usually in a [[bathtub]], [[bathroom]], or [[onsen]], with the body [[partially submerged]] in some fluid. 

If the body is not partially submerged but the character is still cleaning their body, they are most likely either [[showering]] or simply [[wiping]] themselves.

title: user_interface
body:
Posts depicting a [i]tangibly visible[/i] user interface, that is, a visual layout of various elements that a user might need in order to interact with software or some other technological product. Often features buttons, overlaid text, and/or a list or menu of choices. Older or more technically-oriented user interfaces may instead consist purely of text on a solid color background.

Most game screenshots or spoofs of the same ([[fake screenshot]]s inspired by games) will likely qualify for this tag. 

Avoid using this tag for physical input devices or other mechanical elements if there is no visible "UI screen", even if they might technically qualify as user interfaces (e.g. HID) in a formal sense.

h4. Music/video control

* [[Rewind button]] / [[Fast forward button]]
* [[Play button]] / [[Pause button]]
* [[Volume symbol]]
* [[Shuffle button]]
* [[Repeat button]]

h4. See also
* [[Art program in frame]]
* [[Character select]]
* [[Context menu]]
* [[Desktop (computing)|]]
* [[Dialogue box]]
* [[Gameplay mechanics]]
* [[Heads-up display]]
* [[Fake screenshot]]
* [[Interface censor]]
* [[Outside of play area]]
* [[Window (computing)|]]
* [[Visual novel]]
* [[XYZ axis]]
* [[Tag group:drawing software]]

title: xyz_axis
body:
A set of orthogonal arrows for indicating the X, Y, and Z axis in a three-dimensional space. This is often seen in [[3D]] modeling programs as a tool to manipulate objects by moving, rotating, or transforming them. The arrows are usually red, green, and blue for X,Y, and Z respectively.

Besides arrows, the tool can have other appearances for the different functions mentioned above. One such variation is a set of circles, similar to a [[gyroscope]], for rotating objects.

h4. See also

* [[Art program in frame]]
* [[Cursor]]
* [[User interface]]

title: eishin_flash_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. German exchange student and punctuality-obsessed model of German efficiency.

She has [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|short]]-to-[[medium hair|medium]] [[black hair]] in a [[bob cut]] with [[swept bangs]] and [[hair between eyes]]. She wears an [[ear scrunchie]] around her right ear. While she canonically has [[medium breasts]], her breast size is often [[large_breasts|exaggerated]] in fanart.

title: duramente_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. She has [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]] with a white streak on her forehead as well as an [[ahoge]]. She comes from a family of athletes and grew up with [[Air Groove (umamusume)|]], whom she calls "Gurunee" (グル姉).

She was first introduced as a surprise to viewers watching the premiere of the 3rd season of the [i]Umamusume[/i] anime, where she beat protagonist [[Kitasan Black (umamusume)|]] and [[Satono Crown (umamusume)|]]. Duramente's introduction to the story sent shockwaves among the fanbase, as this meant that other horses of the same owner (Sunday Racing) could now be part of the world of [i]Umamusume[/i]; especially since up to that point the horse was substituted by an original NPC named [[Brusquement_(umamusume)|]].

title: dream_journey_(umamusume)
body:
A character from [[Umamusume]].

A [[petite]] [[horse girl]] who follows the path of her esteemed "Elder Sister".

While at 144cm, she isn't the shortest character in the franchise, she has the absolute smallest bust with 66cm. In fact, she has the smallest proportions of any character (B66/W48/H69), having lower measurements than [[Nishino Flower (umamusume)|]] (B67/W48/H70). This is based on the fact that the real Dream Journey was one of the smallest racehorses of his caliber.

title: obliterate!!!_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The signature attack of [[Exodia the Forbidden One]], later receiving the namesake card for the [[duel monster]] card game.

After Exodia is successfully summoned, he performs this attack by charging an [[energy ball]] between his palms, then he unleashes an [[energy beam]] from it, literally obliterating the opponent's monster and instantly winning the duel.

title: kirby_(series)
body:
Video game series by [[Nintendo]] and [[HAL Laboratory]]. Known in Japan as [b]Hoshi no Kirby[/b] (Kirby of the Stars). Best known for its surprisingly dark lore despite the game's overall cute asthetics.

There is also an anime adaptation that goes by the same name in Japan. When it was dubbed in English, it was given another name: [[Kirby: Right Back At Ya!]]

title: v_sisters
body:
A group of three [[horse girl]] [[sisters]] from [[Umamusume]], [[Cheval Grand (Umamusume)|]], [[Verxina (Umamusume)|]], and [[Vivlos (Umamusume)|]]. They are called the V sisters for the V (or ヴ kana) in their names.

In real life, those three horses were foaled by [[Halwa Sweet (Racehorse)|]], a racemare known for having no tail except for the very end. [[Cheval Grand (Umamusume)|]] (the chestnut colt) was sired by [[Heart's Cry (racehorse)|]] and the other two (both black mares) were sired by [[Deep Impact (racehorse)|]]. They also share retired pitcher [[Sasaki Kazuhiro]] as their owner. For their Umamusume counterparts, this is translated into all sisters sharing an interest and strong point in [[baseball]].

They also share a cowlick on their bangs (in Cheval Grand's case, it's the blaze marking) and [[blue eyes]]. Where they differ is whether or not they have [[mole under eye|a mole under an eye]] (Cheval Grand doesn't) as well as the shade of blue of their eyes (sky blue for Cheval Grand, a dark purplish blue for the mares). Their base costumes also follow the same marine theme and theme naming: Cheval Grand has "Grand Itinéraire" ("Great Itinerary") and Vivlos has "Voyage Étincelant" ("Brilliant Journey"). Verxina, however, has "Le beau sommet" ("The beautiful summit"), befitting her own name.

Use this tag when all three members are intentionally grouped together in a post. 

h4. Examples

* !post #7528404

title: golden_generation_(umamusume)
body:
A grouping of [[horse girl]]s in [[Umamusume]], consisting of [[El Condor Pasa (Umamusume)|]], [[Grass Wonder (Umamusume)|]], [[King Halo (Umamusume)|]], [[Seiun Sky (Umamusume)|]], [[Special Week (Umamusume)|]], and optionally [[Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi (Umamusume)|]]. In real life, they were all three year olds in 1998 who could potentially participate in the classics of that year (although in the traditional age counting system used until 2000, they were considered four year olds).

Use this tag when all five (or six) members are grouped together in a post. [[Tsurumaru Tsuyoshi (Umamusume)|]] is optional because she was implemented in the game later.

h4. Examples

* !post #5090341
* !post #9524857

title: vivlos_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. She first appeared in the third season of the anime. Voiced by [[Itou Ayasa]]. 

A cute but flirty young lady who wants to race at [[Dubai]]. She is the youngest of the three [[V sisters]], the other two being [[Verxina (umamusume)|]] and [[Cheval Grand (umamusume)|]].

Her impish nature is displayed by her constant [[:3|cat mouth]]. She calls her [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] "Traicchi" (トレっち), which follows how she nicknames those she is particularly affectionate with (i.e. [[Cheval Grand (umamusume)|"Chevacchi"]]).

title: takara_miyuki
body:
One of four main characters from [[Lucky Star]]. She likes reading long novels and informing her friends with her massive mental trivia library (she's sometimes called MiWiki by fans). She is prone to running into things or spacing out while reading.

She is a taller, curvy girl with long [[pink hair]], [[glasses]], and [[purple eyes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7432545

title: hiiragi_tsukasa
body:
Character from [[Lucky Star]]. Due to being born the second, she's sometimes referred as a younger sister to [[Hiiragi Kagami]], her twin sister. She is kind-hearted, but lazy and never does her homework. Tsukasa is very good at housework. 

She has [[short hair|short]] [[purple hair]] usually accented with a [[yellow hairband]] tied on top, and [[tareme]] [[blue eyes]]. She also bears a resemblance to [[Kamigishi Akari]] from [[To Heart]].

For some strange reason, [[leica (leica xx)|]] frequently features her in [[fine art parody|fine art parodies]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7432549

h4. See also

* [[Lucky Star]]
* [[Hiiragi Kagami]]
* [[Izumi Konata]]

title: izumi_konata
body:
One of the four main characters from [[Lucky Star]]. She's apparently an anime and manga addict or [[otaku]]. She also likes [[video game]]s a lot and is quite skilled at them.

Izumi is a very [[petite]] girl who looks only about 12 to 13 years old despite her real age being actually much older (making her some type of [[loli]] bait to fellow otaku). She has very long blue hair with an [[ahoge]], [[green eyes]], a [[mole_under_eye|mole]] beneath her left eye, and permanently [[:3]] shaped lips. Her [[serafuku]] is called [[ryouou school uniform]]

h4. Appearance

* !post #7432542

title: bolzano_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Italian heavy cruiser [i]Bolzano[/i]. Character design by [[Haori Io]], voiced by Maekawa Ryouko. 

She has [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] tied to a [[single braid]], [[red eyes]], and [[large breasts]]. 

Her default outfit consists of a [[black dress]] with a white breast side, armor pieces on her waists, [[white hat|white]] [[peaked cap]], [[white skirt|white]] [[pleated skirt]], [[two-sided fabric|two-tone]] coat ([[white coat|white]] outer with [[epaulettes]], [[green coat|green]] inner), [[mismatched legwear|mismatched thighhighs]] ([[white thighhighs|white]] on her left, [[black thighhighs|black]] on her right), black [[thigh strap]] on her right leg, [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves]] (with a single [[gauntlets|gauntlet]] on her right), and [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels]]. 

Her [[rigging]] consists of two separate hull pieces, each containing two 20.3 cm twin gun mounts, a 10 cm twin [[anti-aircraft gun]] mount, a mast, and a gunnery director.

title: anti-materiel_rifle
body:
A [[rifle]] that can be used against targets other than humans, such as parked aircraft, soft-skinned or lightly-armored vehicles, ammunition dumps, and the like. Usually has caliber of 12.7mm (.50) or larger.

They are essentially very large [[sniper rifle]]s. Though not specifically designed for anti-personnel use, they are sometimes used in that role.

title: tepetlisaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

One of the species of Saurian living in Natlan. Tepetlisaurs are exceptionally good at digging, and can tunnel through the ground or even up cliffsides. The Children of Echoes tribe is most closely associated with them.

Tepetlisaurs are primarily brown and black in color, with some orange coloring. They are bipedal and have two short arms; all four limbs have claws that are orange or black. They also have a tail.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25953688: Adult Tepetlisaurus
* !asset #25953694: Tepetlisaurus Whelps 

h4. See also

* [[Yumkasaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Iktomisaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Qucusaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Koholasaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Tatankasaurus (genshin impact)|]]

title: tatankasaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

One of the Saurian species found in Natlan. They are capable of charging and ramming with exceptional speed and power, easily capable of shattering boulders. The Collective of Plenty tribe is most closely associated with them.

Tatankasaurs are quadrupeds with small black claws. They have a white carapace with gold edges surrounding their head, which is where the horns of adult Tatankasaurs grow. They have blue eyes, a mane of white hair around their neck, and a primarily blue body.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25945968: Adult Tatankasaurus
* !asset #25945974: Tatankasaurus Whelps

h4. See also

* [[Iktomisaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Qucusaurus (genshin impact)|]]
* [[Koholasaurus (genshin impact)|]]

title: yumkasaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

A species of Saurian that lives in Natlan. Yumkasaurs have long tongues that can grapple objects, and they use this ability to eat and swiftly move around. The Scions of the Canopy tribe is most closely associated with them.

Yumkasaurs are primarily green and white in color, with some yellow pigments. They have long ears and a bulky tail they can sit on. Yumkasaurs are bipedal and have two short arms; yellow claws can be found on all four limbs.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25953775: Adult Yumkasaurus
* !asset #25953786: Yumkasaurus Whelps

title: koholasaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

A type of Saurian found in Natlan. It can freely swim through water, as well as liquid Phlogiston that is as hot as lava. The People of the Springs tribe is most closely associated with them.

Koholasaurs are primarily light blue and black in color with a white underside, as well as some sparse orange pigments. Small fins on the head have orange coloring inside, and black outside. They have a dorsal fin and a long tail. They have two arms and two legs, though these arms are closer to fins for young Koholasaurs.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #25953838: Adult Koholasaurus
* !asset #25953841: Koholasaurus Whelps

title: qucusaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

A type of Saurian found in Natlan. They are capable of flight, and can spit fire. The Flower-Feather Clan tribe is most closely associated with them.

Qucusaurs are primarily bright pink and white in color, with red and yellow eyes. They are bipedal, and stand on two [[talons]]. They also have two wings and long tail feathers. Adult Qucusaurs are covered in feathers and have a single [[ahoge]]-like feather on their heads; young Qucusaurs lack these feathers and ahoge.

title: iktomisaurus_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[creature]] in [[Genshin Impact]].

A type of Saurian found in Natlan. They can leap to great heights, glide, have the ability to use Cryo blasts, and have enhanced sensory abilities that allow them to manifest objects from graffiti. The Masters of the Night-Wind tribe is most closely associated with them.

Iktomisaurs are mostly blue and white in color, with blue eyes and orange highlights under their eyes. They have cape-like feathers that extend from their shoulders, used for gliding. They have tall and slender builds, are bipedal, stand on two [[talons]], and have very large ears that extend over the top of their heads.

title: hazuna_rio
body:
The creator of [[Cookie (touhou)|]], usually depicted as [[Kirisame Marisa]] wearing a sheet printed with [[Shanghai Doll]] on the front. Known for sexually harassing the voice actors during its production, [[Hinase_(cookie)|]] in particular. Nicknamed "the root of all evil, the scum of humanity" by the Cookie community. He has since been doxxed and driven off the internet multiple times. 

He produced many Touhou animations and voice dramas before Cookie, even getting some fame with his "Able-Bodied" series. His moderate level of fame and and willingness to spend money is what allowed the original Cookie voice drama to have a total of 43 people involved. What was less known was that he was largely spending this money to meet underage girls by flying out, taking them to [[crab]] dinners and sexually harassing them by touching them and showing them ero-doujins. Once the controversy began, the [[Manatsu no yo no inmu|Inmu]] and Touhou fans of NicoNicoDouga joined together to destroy all of his accounts on other sites and make sure he would never be able to return to this day.

In fan art he is always drawn as a villain, tempting young girls with fame in exchange for sexual favors. Drawn with the other directors too, especially his successor, [[Taisa (cookie)|]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20571296

title: hortensia_(fire_emblem)
body:
Character from [[Fire Emblem Engage]]. The second princess of Elusia and [[Ivy (fire emblem)|]]'s half-sister.

She has [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[pink hair]] with [[white hair|white]] [[streaked hair|streaks]]. Hair style consists two [[hair rings]] with [[sidelocks]], [[hair flaps]] and [[blunt bangs]], [[short hair]] in length. She has [[pink eyes]] with a [[heart facial mark]] / [[heart tattoo]] under her right eye.

Her main costume includes a [[frilled dress|frilled]], [[layered dress|layered]], [[cross-laced dress|cross-laced]], [[two-tone dress|two-tone]] [[blue dress|blue]]/[[aqua dress]] with [[vertical-striped dress|vertical stripes]], [[criss-cross halter]] and [[juliet sleeves|juliet]], [[fur-trimmed sleeves|fur-trimmed]] [[long sleeves]], [[pink sash]] and a [[cleavage cutout]]. The dress has three [[red rose]]s attached to it. Her legs are covered in [[vertical-striped pantyhose|vertical-striped]] [[two-tone pantyhose|two-tone]] [[blue pantyhose|blue]]/[[aqua pantyhose]]. She has [[pointy boots|pointy]] [[blue boots|blue]] [[high heels]] as her footwear and a [[multicolored tiara]] decorated with [[pink gemstone]] on top of her head.

Her casual costume includes a [[layered skirt|layered]], [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[blue skirt]], [[black dress]] with a [[red rose]] attached, [[pink jacket|pink]] [[cropped jacket]] with [[epaulettes]] and [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], [[black pantyhose]] with a [[floral print]], [[pointy shoes|pointy]] [[red shoes|red]] [[high heels]], [[black choker]], [[black gloves]], [[heart earrings]] and a [[polka dot bow|polka-dotted]] [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow]].

title: tekkou-chan_(morros)
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Morros]]. A girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[blue hair|blue]]-[[streaked hair|streaked]] [[blonde hair]] (fully blonde in early depictions) with [[crossed bangs]] that she usually wears in long [[twintails]], whose most distinguishing feature is a [[huge weapon|massive]] [[mechanical arms|pair of robotic hands]] that she wears as [[exoskeleton|exoskeletal]] [[power fist]]s. Other distinctive features include a pair of blue and yellow hairclips on each side of her hair, a mostly blue [[triangle hair ornament]] under the left hairclip.

As of her current portrayal, she typically wears a [[white leotard|white]] [[two-tone leotard|and]] [[blue leotard|blue]], [[sleeveless leotard|sleeveless]] and [[highleg leotard]] with a [[back cutout|cutout over her lower back]], a black [[harness]] whose numerous straps extend from her hips to [[chest harness|around and above her chest]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[half gloves]], a black [[thigh strap]] with an attached [[thigh pouch|pouch]], a [[black jacket]] with a [[two-sided jacket|blue inner side]], and [[white shoes|white]] [[two-tone shoes|and]] [[blue shoes|blue]] [[sneakers]].

Her name literally means "Hand Armor" or "Gauntlet".

title: gojou's_imaginary_technique
body:
[[Gojou Satoru]]'s Hollow Purple technique, combining the attracting force of Lapse: Blue and the repulsive force of Reversal: Red to create a sphere of imaginary mass that effectively erases all it comes in contact with, from [[Jujutsu Kaisen]]. 

A common [[scene reference]] from his second fight with [[Fushiguro Touji]], it's most often used to parody a character's strongest attack, or simply elevate a tonal shift from something comedic to extremely serious, a la mimicking [[Araki Hirohiko]]'s [[araki hirohiko (style)|style]].

h4. Examples

title: king_penguin
body:
A type of [[penguin]] native to Antarctica. The second tallest and largest of all penguin species, second to [[emperor penguin]]. Adults are recognizable by their gray and yellowish fur around their ears and neck. [[penguin chick|Chicks]] are recognizable by their brown fur.

They can very easily be confused with [[emperor penguin]]s and gigant penguins, however, king penguins are smaller and the colors around their ears and necks are different.

title: meiko_(vocaloid)
body:
MEIKO is a Japanese [[VOCALOID]] developed by the YAMAHA Corporation and distributed by Crypton Future Media, Inc., and was released for the first VOCALOID engine. She was later adopted by Crypton as an official [[Piapro Studio|PIAPRO]] character.

She has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]] and wears a [[red skirt|red]] [[miniskirt]], [[sleeveless]] [[crop top]], and [[boots]]. She is often seen with a [[microphone stand]], and is also frequently seen drinking from One Cup Ozeki, a [[sake]] widely available through vending machines.

She is voiced by singer [[Haigo Meiko]]. Her first appearance was illustrated by [[Wasshi (wassy_m)|]], with her [[Meiko (Vocaloid3)|second appearance]] for VOCALOID3 illustrated by [[iXima]].

title: prometheus_(honkai_impact)
body:
[[Honkai Impact 3rd]] playable character.

Terminal Aide 0017 "Prometheus" was a Previous Era super AI created by [[mei_(honkai_impact)|Dr. MEI]] to predict and manage Honkai attacks. Its exact fate after the coming of Finality is unknown, although [[Mobius (Honkai Impact)|]] is recorded as having spoken to it shortly before that. The version relevant to the Current Era originates from a bubble universe, albeit one almost identical to the main universe.

Appearance-wise, she greatly resembles [[Bronya Zaychik]], to the point that a certain character mistook it for [[Bronya Zaychik (Haxxor Bunny)|Haxxor Bunny]], but has [[red eyes]] and [[robot joints]] and lacks the [[crossed bangs]]. She is also voiced in Japanese by [[Asumi Kana]], but with a robotic filter.

title: habromania
body:
An [[Alice in Wonderland]]-inspired RPG that follows 19-year-old Alice as she tries to escape the surreal, cozy hellscape that is Wonderland—hopefully with her sanity intact. Alice wakes up at the bottom of a hole with a pounding headache and no memories of how she landed there- or memories in general, actually. 

The game explores themes of psychological horror and features multiple endings based on player choices, with a karma system influencing the fate of Wonderland's inhabitants and Alice herself.

title: traffic_cone_lizard_(changed)
body:
Traffic Cone Lizards are yellow anthro lizards that come from striped traffic cones, these traffic cones can be found in the [[dark latex nest]]s. The traffic cones are semi-hazardous obstacles that do not transfur on contact but may lead the player into a transfur, the traffic cones can also be used to the player's advantage during puzzles.

In a puzzle, they can be picked up and carried on the human's head, then placed elsewhere. They are used in another puzzle to block off White Latex puppies and Raccoons. Carrying one out of this room will result in a unique transfur, appearing to be a yellow reptile.
 
In the vents, this transfur can be obtained by wearing a traffic cone out of the disinfection room in the form of a onesie being placed on Colin ([[Lin (Changed)]]) he successfully gets it off, but not without being transfurred and the onesie gaining sentience. 

After the transfur, Colin takes on the appearance of a white dog, and the lizard seems to look more like a canine.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #27780656
* !asset #27780657

title: yuin_(changed)
body:
Yuin (小淫 Xiǎoyín), also known as the False Savepoint, is a light latex creature enemy encountered throughout [[Changed]], with their first appearance being inside the Library, in the right-most room. They are capable of transforming into an object, and they use this power to trick [[Lin_(changed)|]] into letting them transfur him. 

In its undisturbed form, it looks like a regular savepoint, but with a slight tilt to the sprite. Upon being disturbed when the player comes into proximity with it, it will melt into a white blob and drop down onto the ground and begin to chase down the player. It's too fast and is physically impossible to outrun, so in order to survive, the player must ensure that they keep their distance.

When Colin gets transfurred he will have [[white fur]], [[black shorts]], [[purple hair]] with a short length, floppy goat ears, small white [[two-tone horns]] that are black at the top, and [[yellow eyes]] with white colored [[slit pupils]]. After the transfurmation, Yuin dances. 

h4. Appearance

* !asset #27143683

title: cereal_cookie
body:
Cereal Cookie, is a Cookie who was created for [[Cookie Run: OvenBreak]] sometime during or before April 2022. Cereal Cookie was first made publicly known in DevNow 2022, where during the Cookie Run: OvenBreak segment, a variety of concept designs for Cookies that were both released and unreleased were displayed. Later that day, CM Rose hosted a livestream where some of the concept art was displayed in high quality, including Cereal Cookie.

Cereal Cookie's pet is 두유 팩, translated as "Soy Milk Pack". Based on concept art, Cereal Cookie is a busy school student who enjoys eating cereal quickly for the day to go by faster. Their skill appears to involve the Cookie jumping into a bowl of cereal with soy milk being poured inside.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #26554753

title: bonus_time_jellies
body:
Bonus Time Jellies, also known as alphabet jellies, are special colorful jellies that exist in [[Cookie Run: Ovenbreak]]. These jellies can be found in places like Cookie Trials, or Trophy Races. When you collect enough of these colorful jellies, your cookie will be sent to the  the 'Bonus Time World'. In the Bonus Time session, the Cookie is completely safe. Their Energy will not drain, and there are no obstacles to hit, just many high-scoring Jellies to collect.

Collecting these jellies will usually spell out as "BONUSTIME", but when you're playing in Cotton Candy Cookie's trial or Birthday Cake Cookie's trial, collecting Bonus Time Jellies will spell out the words "ILOVEYOU" or "HAPPY BDAY".

title: dr_k_(changed)
body:
Dr. K is the main antagonist of [[Changed]]. They are a scientist from before the events of the game, whom intentionally transfurred themself using their own drug that would allow its user to retain their memories and free will. They try multiple times to contain the human ([[Lin_(changed)|]]), who they believe may carry the virus, from the outside world.

Dr. K is a bioengineer scientist, and as such, they operate with a cold and calculated behavior - which is especially noticeable in the Special Edition where they completely disregard [[Puro]]'s and Colin's attempts to leave and interfering with him maintaining the probable safety of the remaining human population. They display deep concern for the survival of humanity. This is in spite of themself no longer being human, which they mention several times. They are committed to keep the protagonist in the Thunder Science facility to prevent the virus from spreading again.

As a male, Dr. K is a white wolf with red eyes. He wears a respiratory gas mask, and his only article of clothing is an oversized white lab coat.

As a female, Dr. K mostly has the same base appearance, except she has hair-long fur heavily resembling hair. Her gas mask has more detail, and the oversized trench coat has been replaced with her laboratory coat styled to look like a dress, and she lacks the tuft of fur on her chest.

h4. Appearance

title: original_race_uniform_(umamusume)
body:
The generic [[gym uniform]] racing outfit shared by every racer in [[Umamusume]], used for races graded G2 and lower. Player characters don't wear it by default unless the proper option is set to make the player character less conspicuous.

Consists of a color-coded [[gym uniform]] (with "colts"/right-eared umas wearing [[gym shorts]] and "fillies"/left-eared umas wearing [[buruma]]) and [[race bib]] bearing the racer's gate number. Legwear is to the character's discretion.

h4. Examples

* !post #3216233: Shorts
* !post #6281914: Buruma

title: gunslinger_(ragnarok_online)
body:
An expanded job in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can be equipped with a variety of [[holding gun|guns]] but most commonly seen [[dual wielding]] [[handgun]]s.

Males wear a [[brown coat]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], [[black gloves]], [[brown pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

Females wear an [[open jacket|open]] [[brown jacket]] with [[long sleeves|long]] [[fur-trimmed sleeves]], a [[crop top|cropped]] [[brown tank top]], [[black gloves]], [[brown pants]], and [[white boots]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7298192
* !post #7298194

body:
One of the possible 2nd jobs of the [[Taekwon (ragnarok online)|]] in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Usually are equipped with [[holding staff|staff]]s or [[holding books|book]]. 

Males wear a [[hanbok]] of a [[white shirt]] with  [[long sleeves|long]] [[wide sleeves]], [[brown pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

Females wear a [[hanbok]] of a light [[brown shirt]] with [[long sleeves]], a [[brown skirt]] with a [[pelvic curtain]], and [[white shoes]].

title: soul_reaper_(ragnarok_online)
body:
3rd job of the Soul Linker class tree in [[Ragnarok Online]]. Can equip a wide variety of weapons, including [[staff]]s, [[knife|knives]], and their own [[clenched hands|fists]].

Males wear an [[open coat|open]] [[black coat]] over a [[red vest]] and [[black shirt]], [[black gloves|black]] [[fingerless gloves]] with [[bead bracelet]]s, a [[championship belt]], [[black pants]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[shoes]].

Females wear a [[black shirt]] with [[hip vent]]s and [[short over long sleeves|additional]] [[white sleeves]], a [[black skirt]] with [[tassel]]s, [[black thighhighs]] with [[garter straps]], [[bead bracelet]]s, and [[white shoes]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #7301467
* !post #7301475

title: captain_3_(splatoon)
body:
[[Official alternate costume]] of [[Agent 3 (splatoon)|]] from [[Splatoon 1]] and [[Splatoon 2]] as the captain of the "New [[Squidbeak Splatoon]]" in [[Splatoon 3]]'s single player campaign. Can still be either male or female.

Wears a blue [[peaked cap]], a [[patchwork_clothes|patchwork]] poncho with a loose [[grey shirt]] along with a form-fitting [[torn_clothes|torn]] black shirt and [[yoga pants]] underneath. They also wear a pair of black [[flip-flops]] with glowing blue lights lining the sandal straps and their [[tentacle_hair|hair tentacles]] have received a number of cuts and scars.

title: tally
body:
Marks made to keep [[counting|count]] of something.

Western style tally marks use four vertical lines with a fifth diagonal line drawn through them to mark five. In East Asia (including Japan), the character 正 is used to keep a tally. Each stroke in the character counts as one tally, with a total of five.

For the non-sexual use of tally marks to count kills by a weapon or vehicle, use [[kill markings]] instead. 

h4. See also

* [[body writing]]
* [[pregnancy mark]]

title: ryoma_(fire_emblem)
body:
A playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

The eldest brother of the Hoshidan royal family. [[corrin (fire emblem)|Corrin]] (the Avatar)'s real elder brother. A very reliable person who is the epitome of the way of the warrior, a prime practitioner of Bushido. He is not only regarded as a talented warrior and leader, but also provides much comfort and support to the Avatar. He wields the legendary lightning katana [[raijinto (fire emblem)|Raijintou]].

Ryouma has [[very long hair|very]] [[long hair|long]] [[spiked hair|spiky]] [[brown hair]] and [[brown eyes]], and wears [[red armor|red]] [[armor]] with [[white pants|white]] [[pants]] and a [[white coat|white]] [[long coat]] on top of his signature protective [[mask]].

He is voiced by [[Nakamura Yuuichi]] in the Japanese version and by [[Matthew Mercer]] in the English localization.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Swordmaster

h4. Appearance

title: hinoka_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Hinoka[/b] is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem Fates]]. 

Elder Princess of the Kingdom of Hoshido. She has a simple and honest personality that is fitting of a warrior. She took up learning the art of war after [[Corrin (fire emblem)|]] was kidnapped.

She is voiced by [[Nazuka Kaori]] in the Japanese version.

[b]Starting Class[/b]: Pegasus Warrior

title: clutch_purse
body:
A women's wallet, also known as a clutch, is a type of [[handbag]] without a shoulder strap or handles, instead designed to be carried in the hands, which resembles a larger [[wallet]]. They are typically rectangular, but may sometimes be wedge-shaped. They may rarely include a short strap or chain with which to carry them, but are still intended to be carried in the hands rather than over the shoulder.

h4. Examples

* !post #4879544
* !post #7313840
* !post #9151625

title: eri_(blue_archive)
body:
A playable character from [[Blue Archive]]. She is a student of Wild Hunt Academy and the president of Occult Studies Club. She calls [[Sensei (Blue Archive)|]] “Master”.

Her full name is [b]Shirao Eri[/b].

Eri has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] tied into a [[low-tied long hair|low-tied]] [[low ponytail]] with a [[single braid|single]] [[side braid]], [[crossed bangs]] hanging [[hair between eyes|between her eyes]], [[orange eyes]] and a [[yellow halo]]. She wears a [[black hat|black]] [[witch hat]] with a [[red ribbon|red]] [[hat ribbon]], an [[open jacket|open]] [[black jacket|black]] [[hooded jacket]] overtop a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[white shirt]], a [[diagonal-striped bowtie|diagonal-striped]] [[red bowtie]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[black skirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]] and a pair of [[black shoes]]. She also has [[hair bobbles]], [[gold earrings]] and [[multiple rings]] on both hands.
Eri is the only other student besides [[Hanako (Blue Archive)|Urawa Hanako]] with a halo that's located in a different position of her head compared to the other students, being in the front-left side of her head instead. 

Her firearm is a [[Carcano]] [[bolt action]] [[rifle]] "[b]Arcana: [[Mage staff]][/b]". 

Voiced by: [[Imaizumi Riona]]
Original artist: [[gulim]] 

h4. Appearance

* !post #9817040: Default

h4. External links

* "Blue Archive Wiki: Eri":https://bluearchive.wiki/wiki/Eri
