title: hina_misora
body:
A [[Virtual Youtuber]] under [[WACTOR production]]'s second generation. She's a charismatic and energetic apprentice [[idol]] who fell from the sky and lost her memory, but was rescued by a [[whale]] named [[Kujira-chan (hina misora)|]]. Her first language is Japanese, but she also has an advanced level of Spanish. However, with the way she expresses, she is often misinterpreted (out of context) by her fans due to the double entendre in Spanish.

She has [[yellow eyes|yellow]] and [[pink eyes|pink]] [[gradient eyes]] with [[cross-shaped pupils]], [[blue nails]], and [[two-tone hair|two-tone]] [[long hair]] which is mainly [[black hair|black]] with [[pink hair|pink]] [[colored inner hair]] and a couple [[streaked hair|hair streaks]]. Originally her hair was arranged in a [[two side up]] tied with blue [[hair ribbon]]s and one [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]]. Her second outfit had [[low twintails]] and her third outfit had a [[double bun]].

Her fan marks are a whale and a star (🐳✨) and her fanbase on youtube are called "[[Misopita (hina misora)|]]s," the plural diminutive for her nickname "Misopa", which is a portmanteau of Misora's name and the word "sopa" (Spanish for "soup"). On Bilibili they are also called 「弱PC団」 (weak PC team) due to problems with her desktop PC and internet connection.

Her contract was terminated on the 9th of February, 2023, with [[Meica (vtuber)|]] confirming such on the 15th, along with her former genmates releasing statements on WACTOR, prompting retaliatory action from their former employer.

title: sega
body:
[b]Sega Corporation[/b] (usually styled as [b]SEGA[/b]), is a Japanese multinational [[video game]] developer, publisher and hardware development company. Originally a maker of video [[game console]]s, it later shifted into just creating and publishing video games for other game consoles.

SEGA is the creator of the popular [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise. Since 2013, it is the parent company of fellow publisher [[Atlus]].

SEGA was a major [[arcade]] operator and owned several iconic arcades in Japan. Due to declining income, especially caused by the COVID-19 Pandemic, in 2022 they completely sold off their arcade operations division to GENDA Inc. All remaining SEGA branded arcades to be rebranded with the "GiGO" logo (short for "Get into the Gaming Oasis").

title: star_wars:_the_last_jedi
body:
An epic [[science fiction]] and [[fantasy]] film from 2017. It is part of the [[Star Wars]] franchise now owned by [[Disney]].

[i][b]Star Wars: The Last Jedi[/b][/i] (also known as [i][b]Episode VIII[/b][/i]) is the second of a new "sequel trilogy" of films with a plot set cronologically 30 years after the events of the "original trilogy" of Star Wars movies from the late 70s and early 80s. This film is very controversial, dividing the audience, considered by many to be the worst Star Wars film, there is a sentiment that [[Luke Skywalker|Luke's]]  actions contradicted his previous heroic portrayal.

It is a direct sequel to the [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]] film from 2015.

The new film premiered in December 2017.

h4. Sequels

title: kylo_ren
body:
Character introduced in the [[Star Wars]] sequel trilogy.

[b]Kylo Ren[/b] is the personal apprentice of Supreme Leader [[Snoke]] and the leader of the Knights of Ren, a group of [[darksider (star wars)|Dark Side users]] who are inspired by (but distinct from) the original [[Sith]] cult. 

Kylo is one of the commanders of the [[First Order]], and shows no hesitancy in using brute force to achieve his goals. He wields a red [[crossguard lightsaber]] and his apprearance is reminiscent of [[Darth Vader]]'s, wearing a face-obscuring helmet and long black clothing.

He is introduced in [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens]], and is played by American actor "Adam Driver":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_Driver.

h4. See also

[spoiler]* [[Ben Solo]][/spoiler]

title: scarlet_(fire_emblem)

She is voiced by Ayano Ishikawa in the Japanese version.

title: cammy_white
body:
A character in the [[Street Fighter]] series. Her codename is [b]Killer Bee[/b] (christened in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|Street Fighter Zero 3]] and kept for herself afterwards). She first appeared in the fighting game [[Street Fighter II (series)|Super Street Fighter II]] (1993) as one of the titular "New Challengers," the four new characters introduced in that title.

Cammy is a female clone of [[M. Bison]], originally serving within his organization [[Shadaloo]] as both Bison's potential replacement body should his original body fail, and, until then, the leader of the [[Shadaloo Dolls]] - Bison's personal unit of brainwashed bodyguards and underlings. She later went rogue after her encounter with [[Dhalsim]] nullified Bison's Psycho Powered mind control. As of [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] onward to the present in [[Street Fighter 6]], she serves as a member of Delta Red, a British special forces unit with connections to MI6. She has made it her personal mission to locate, rescue, and rehabilitate the Dolls. She collaborates closely with most of the other World Warriors on her assignments, notably [[Chun-Li]].

Trained extensively in close-quarters combat, Cammy likes to strike with quick, sharp attacks like a stinging bee (hence her codename) and use takedowns to immobilize and cripple her foes. Her signature techniques include the [i]Spiral Arrow[/i] and [i]Cannon Spike/Strike[/i] - both flying kick attacks that send Cammy lunging feet first at sharp angles, whether straight forward, up into the sky, or down from the air - as well as the [i]Hooligan Combination[/i], where she hurls herself into close quarters to either grapple the opponent to the ground or strike from odd angles.

She has two well known appearances depending on the Street Fighter timeline, although both have her wearing some manner of [[highleg leotard]] and red gauntlet-like gloves, sporting long [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[twin braids]], and showing off a long [[scar]] on her left cheek.

h4. Appearance

* !post #939647: [[Street Fighter II (series)|]] "Delta Red" (original)
* !post #1291102: [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]][br]"Killer Bee"
* !post #386341: [[Street Fighter IV (series)|]]
* !post #2041295: [[Street Fighter V]]
* !post #6369826: [[Street Fighter 6]]

Her original "Delta Red" appearance, worn in every instance outside her Alpha/Zero appearances prior to Street Fighter 6, has her in a green [[highleg leotard]] with a small triangle badge above her right breast and a red [[beret]]. [[Street Fighter V]] adds a [[chest harness]] and a [[thigh holster]] on her right leg, but loses the green patches of [[bodypaint]] originally seen on her legs. The bodypaint does make a return in Street Fighter 6 as part of her Street Fighter V form/"younger self" alternate skin. Her appearance in [[Fortnite]] as a Gaming Legends outfit skin adds [[pantyhose]] with a [[camouflage]] pattern to her Street Fighter V outfit.

In her Alpha/Zero "Killer Bee" appearance, which takes place during the time she was a member of M. Bison's Dolls, she instead wears a light blue long-sleeved [[ribbed leotard|ribbed]] [[highleg leotard]] with a matching color [[garrison cap]] and a small yellow necktie with a black armband on her left arm. Like in her original form, she has bodypaint patches on her legs, except they are blue to match her leotard and somewhat [[lightning bolt symbol|lightning bolt]]-shaped.

In [[Street Fighter 6]], Cammy has [[short hair|cut her hair short]], and she now sports a [[blue jacket|blue]] [[cropped jacket|bolero]] with [[Union Jack]] print, [[black sports bra]] and black [[yoga pants]].

title: reverse_collapse_(series)
body:
Umbrella tag for the series created by developer MICA Team, beginning in 2013 with [[Codename: Bakery Girl]] (a remake of the 2008/09 visual novel "Girl of the Bakehouse/Girl in the Bakehouse ~ Withered"). title: tallinn_(azur_lane)
body:
[[Azur Lane]]'s personification of the Soviet heavy cruiser [i]Tallinn[/i].

She has [[very long hair|very long]] [[white hair]] with a small red highlight, [[red eyes]] and [[mole_on_breast|mole on her right breast]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white headwear|white]] [[peaked cap]], [[white dress|white]] [[halter dress]] with [[white coat|white]] [[fur-trimmed coat]], [[black choker]], [[white gloves|white]] [[elbow gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[white boots|white]] [[lace-up boots|laced-up]] [[high heel boots|high heeled]] [[thigh boots]]. There are several [[iron cross|iron crosses]] adorning her outfit on her [[belt]] and her coat to indicate that she was built in Germany. 

Character design by [[pavapo]], voiced by [[Shitaya Noriko]].

title: crownslayer_(arknights)
body:
[i]Specialist Operator CrownSlayer, bane of tyrants, sword of vengeance.[/i]

A playable Specialist Operator in [[Arknights]].

Real name: [spoiler]Lyudmila Ilinichna[/spoiler]

h4. Profile
[expand]
[table]
[tbody]
      [tr][td]Place of Birth:[/td]
      [td]Ursus[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Birthday:[/td]
      [td]July 22nd[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Race:[/td]
      [td]Reproba[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Height:[/td]
      [td]161 cm[/td][/tr]
      [tr][td]Combat Experience:[/td]
      [td]7 years[/td][/tr]
  [/tbody]
[/table]
[/expand]

Former Reunion movement's squad leader who specialized in melee combat and defense breakthrough. 
She parted with the movement after the Chernobog-Lungmen Incident to Siracusa, 
and eventually approached Rhodes Island to seek Oripathy treatment while under supervision.

Previously an NPC, and a boss during the first arc of the main story, 
and makes a brief appearance in the side story [i]Il Siracurano[/i].
She later became playable in the latter's sequel [i]I Portatori dei Velluti[/i].

Her motif is based on striped [[hyena]]s.

Her [[voice actor]]s are [[Senbongi Sayaka]] (JP) and Chen Yanyi (CN), Evgeniya Vagan (EN), Lee Joo-eun (KR), and Anna Gorkina (RU). 
Her original designer is [[Lowlight Kirilenko]], while her illustrator as a playable operator is [[Zhili Xingzou]].

h4. Appearance
* !post #9869180: Default
* !post #9871741: Elite II
* !post #7879236: NPC

title: lennon_(little_busters!)
body:

title: pencil_dress
body:
A close-fitting [[dress]] with a straight, narrow cut. Generally the hemline ranges from skirt length to miniskirt length, and is tailored for a close fit.

The difference between a [[pencil dress]] and a [[tube dress]] is that a [[tube dress]] is always [[strapless]]. A [[pencil dress]] can have sleeves, straps or a [[halterneck]], and is applicable to all non-strapless dresses with a tight-fitting lower half.

[[Hestia (danmachi)|]]'s white dress is an example of a pencil dress, due to the skirt portion of her dress fitting tightly around/below her hips.

h4. See also
* [[dongtan dress]]
* [[hobble dress]]
* [[pencil skirt]]
* [[taut dress]]
* [[tube dress]]

title: vlov_arkhangel
body:
He is the nineteenth of The Twenty-seven Dead Apostle Ancestors in [[Tsukihime (Remake)|Tsukihime Remake]].

A proud and loyal knight that originates from the frozen lands of the far north,Vlov searches for a way to warm his heart after having inherited his liege [[Zaria Offenbaum]]'s idea blood [b]Freezing (寒さ, Samu-sa)[/b].He travels to Souya after running out of food in his homeland while pursuing [[Arcueid Brunestud]] for revenge.

Vlov absolutely hates [[Michael Roa Valdamjong]] for seemingly stealing the past 200 years away from him.

He has ten wives provided to him by Zaria, whom he seemingly cares deeply for.In [[Tohno Akiha]]' story within [[Melty Blood: Type Lumina]] he tries to get her to be his eleventh wife, but she refuses by the polygamous relationship alone

He has [[medium hair|medium]] [[white hair]], as well as [[red eyes]]. His clothing consists of a [[blue coat]],[[black pants]],[[boots]],[[white gloves]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #8191918
* !post #8200569

h4. See also

* [[javol kopiy]] - Vlov's lance

h4. External links

* "Type-Moon Wiki: Vlov Arkhangel":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Vlov_Arkhangel
other_names: ヴローヴ・アルハンゲリ

title: 774_(nanashi)
body:
Artist.

Used to update very slowly (once every 1-3 months) fueling rumors that he is a pen-name for a well known manga-ka.

Somewhat infamous for creating 1 shots that look like they should be part of a series, then never creating part 2, causing no end of complaining from newbies on the various *chan sites.

Formerly a [[guro]] artist who delved into exhibitionism and humiliation themes. Has reformed since his original creation [[Ijiranaide Nagatoro-san]] debuted and became popular.

title: draw_25_(meme)
body:
A two-image [[meme]] involving [[uno (game)|Uno]] cards, specifically the post-2018 112-card deck with one "swap hands" wild card and three customizable wild cards that have blank spaces on which players can freely write other conditions aside from choosing the next color to play. 

The first image shows one such customizable wild card with the direction "_______ or draw 25" (the blank being an action). The second image shows a person with a large fan of cards, implying the player rather drew 25 cards than doing whatever was demanded of him on the wild card.

The original text that sparked the meme is "call/text your recent ex or draw 25."

h4. External Links:
* "Know Your Meme: Draw 25":[https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/draw-25]

title: chinese_new_year
body:
A holiday celebrating the [[New Year]], also called "Spring Festival" (春节), in the traditional Chinese calendar, a lunisolar calendar, falling sometime between January 21 and February 20. It is mainly celebrated in China, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Macao, in countries with significant Chinese populations, and in Chinatowns elsewhere. It is broadly called "Lunar New Year" because several other "new year" holidays such as Seollal (Korean New Year) and Tết (Vietnamese New Year) are also celebrated around the same time.

Before 1873, the Japanese had celebrated New Year's festivities around the same time as Chinese New Year. Since 1873, however, when Japan adopted the widely used Gregorian calendar, New Year's festivities are being held instead on January 1.

Many of the New year traditions are said to have originated from the legend of [[Nian (mythology)|]].

title: c2_race_queen_uniform
body:
A common green and black [[race queen]] outfit seen during C2's Crane Garden on September 6, 2025, consisting of a [[short_sleeves|short-sleeved]] [[cropped jacket]] worn over a silver [[tube top]] and a [[miniskirt]].

First seen on [[Kantai Collection]]'s [[Ranger (2025 Race Queen) (Kancolle)|Ranger]], the outfit is also officially seen on [[Heian Maru (Kancolle)|]], [[I-201 (Kancolle)|]], and [[I-203 (Kancolle)|]] (all characters illustrated by [[hoshiakari (c2 kikan)|]]) as well as [[Gotland (2025 Race Queen) (Kancolle)|Gotland]] (though her jacket has longer sleeves) and C2 mascot [[C2-Chan]].

While [[Zuikaku (race Queen) (Kancolle)|race queen Zuikaku]]'s outfit is also green and black and was also introduced during the same event, hers is too unique from this uniform and thus should not have this tag.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #32040586: Merchandise featuring characters wearing the C2 race queen uniform as well as uniquely dressed [[Zuikaku (race Queen) (Kancolle)|race queen Zuikaku]]

title: chinese_paper-cut
body:
A traditional Chinese folk art dating back to when paper was developed. Also called "window flowers" because the they are often used to decorate doors and windows. It's done by folding a piece of paper multiple times and cutting out shapes to form a pattern or an image, which is why patterns are often symmetrical.

Paper cutouts may be done with any color, but red ones are especially common and they are used to celebrate festivals like the [[Chinese New Year]]. Paper cutting and paper-cut decorating remain popular New Year activities in the modern days.

h4. See also

* [[kirigami]]
* [[papercraft (medium)]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chinese paper cutting":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chinese_paper_cutting

title: ptsd
body:
[b]Post Traumatic Stress Disorder[/b] ([b]PTSD[/b]) is a [[crazy|mental disorder]] that can develop after a person is exposed to a very traumatic event, such as [[rape|sexual assault]], [[war]]fare, traffic collisions, or other threats on a person's life. Frequent among [[soldier]]s, it used to be called [b]Shell Shock[/b] ([[World War I]]) and [b]Combat Fatigue[/b] ([[World War II]]) in the past.  

Symptoms may include: paranoia, overvigilance, concealment of [[handgun]]s and other weapons for easy access, fear of unexisting threats, disturbing thoughts, feelings, or dreams related to the events (usually war flashbacks in most veterans); mental or physical distress to trauma-related cues; attempts to avoid trauma-related cues and alterations in how a person thinks and feels. 

The most severe cases may feature trauma-related visual and auditory "hallucinations":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hallucination with mental disturbances (such as severe "depression":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Depression_(mood)) that could lead to [[suicide]] or full-on "psychosis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psychosis and [[vegetative_state|loss of contact with reality]].

h4. See also
* [[Survivor guilt]]
* [[The Two-Thousand Yard Stare]]
** [[Thousand yard stare]]

* [[John Rambo]]
* [spoiler][[Kamille Bidan]][/spoiler]
* [[soldier_boy_(the_boys)|Soldier Boy]]

title: empty_eyes
body:
Eyes with no glint or light spots, or that are colored with solid, dull shading.

Can be used to express a wide variety of emotions or states, including [[blank stare]]s, [[expressionless|emotionlessness]], [[angry|anger]], [[crazy|craziness]] (including [[mind break]]s or [[yandere]] behavior), [[possessed|possession]] or [[mind control]], [[blind]]ness, [[unconscious]]ness, or even [[death]].

In [i][[Kemono Friends]][/i], Friends who represent extinct species have empty eyes.

title: surgical_scissors
body:
A pair of [[scissors]] meant specifically for suturing wounds. They're typically lean and silver with circular handles for the finger rings, with the edges of the blades either slightly curved or pronged. 

The modified edges of the blades help hold open a wound being performed on, hold a suture needle, cut open sutures/bandages, and etc. 

Not to be confused with fabric scissors, which have the same general shape/color but thicker blades and one larger finger ring than another.

h4. Examples

* !post #3787244
* !post #6016591

title: alexander_anderson's_pose
body:
A [[fighting_stance|fighting pose]] taken by the character [[Alexander Anderson]] from [[Hellsing]]. 

The most common variation of the pose involves Anderson holding his two weapons, a pair of [[dual wielding|dual wielded]] [[bayonet|bayonets]] together by the flats of their blades in a shape resembling a [[crucifix]]. One arm is held up around the forehead, with the blade facing towards the ground, while the other arm is circled down and around to the opposite shoulder to hold the other blade horizontally as the flat part of the crucifix. The pose is usually framed in such a way that his arms and the bayonets form a box that frames his face or eyes.

h4. Examples

* !post #8896611

title: sally_sinclair
body:
[[Original]] character by [[Merryweather]] and eponymous protagonist of her [[comic]], which can be read "here":[/pools/26036].

She has [[two-tone eyes|two-toned]] [[blue eyes|blue]] and [[pink eyes]] with [[white pupils]]. Her [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]], which features a [[single hair streak|single]] [[black streaks|black streak]], is styled in a [[two side up]] with [[double-parted bangs]]. She is often depicted with a [[fang]], has [[black nails]] and her accessories include a [[black hairband|black]] [[rabbit ear hairband]] and a [[black choker]].

Her usual outfit consists of a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[blue shirt]] with a [[white bow]], a [[high-waist skirt|high-waisted]] [[black skirt]], [[black shoes|black]] [[platform shoes]], an [[o-ring thigh strap]], a [[single thighhigh|single black thighhigh]] and a [[single kneehigh|single black kneehigh]]. She also owns a [[rabbit bag]] which can transform into a [[sentient stuffed toy|sentient rabbit plushie]].

She has a younger brother named [[Silas Sinclair|Silas]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #9399814: Reference sheet

title: satake_mei
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

A Tracen representative in France, Satake Mei is the host for the Project L'Arc scenario, being your guide for the races in Longchamps.

A small tomboyish girl with a sisterly relationship with [[Akikawa Yayoi (umamusume)|]], she has [[short hair|short]] [[brown hair]], [[brown eyes]] and constantly wears a yellow [[baseball cap]] with the Tracen logo. She wears an outfit consisting of [[short shorts|short]] [[brown shorts]], a white t-shirt under a torn black shirt, a yellow and brown hooded jacket and a backpack.

Her unique effect of her SSR card is the ability to appear at two training facilities at once, leading to jokes about being able to duplicate herself.

She is implied to not only be a secret [[horse girl]], she's implied to be [[Dictus (racehorse)|]], as her relationship to Akikawa Yayoi (who is herself implied to be [[Northern Taste (racehorse)|]]), her familiarity to races in France (Dictus is French) and her birthday (April 11) matches. Thus she is often drawn alongside [[Ikuno Dictus (umamusume)|]] and [[Dictus Striker (umamusume)|]] ([[umamusume:_cinderella_gray|Cinderella Gray]]'s iteration of [[Soccer Boy (racehorse)|]]). Her baseball cap does feature three badges with the racing colors of Dictus' best progeny (The two above and Movie Star) on the right side of the hat.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6651233

title: kashimoto_riko
body:
Apparent antagonist character from the [[Umamusume]] game. Current Acting Chairwoman of Tracen Academy, filling in for [[Akikawa Yayoi (umamusume)|]] during the Aoharu League.

She is a former [[Trainer (umamusume)|]] and current high-ranking official of the Umamusume Racing Association (URA). During the events of the Aoharu League she is assigned to act as chairwoman in place of [[Akikawa Yayoi (umamusume)|]] who has been called away on a business trip overseas.

While her most salient trait is that she is very good at projecting her aura of authority, her second most salient trait is the fact that, even for a human being, she has terrible physical stamina and is hopeless at sports, which clashes with the fact that she works in a [i]sporting[/i] environment.

Fans have noticed resemblances between Kashimoto and the real-life horse [[Sunday Silence (racehorse)|]]. Furthermore, Kashimoto's nickname also contains the word "oak", while Sunday Silence was bred by [b]Oak[/b] Cliff Thoroughbreds. The real-life Sunday Silence was also considered the successor of [[Northern Taste (racehorse)|]] ([[Akikawa Yayoi (umamusume)|]]'s counterpart) as a stud at Shadai Stallion Station.

An alternative interpretation is that her character design is based on [[Real Shadai (racehorse)|]], another horse with a similar color scheme (and also resembles Sunday Silence). Real Shadai is the more immediate successor to Northern Taste, before Sunday Silence.

She trains [[Little Cocon (Umamusume)|]] and [[Bitter Glasse (Umamusume)|]].

Voiced by [[Paku Romi]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #5247564

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Kashimoto Riko":[https://umamusume.jp/character/kashimotoriko]

title: night_of_wallachia
body:
Also known as [b]TATARI[/b] (タタリ, curse). Dead Apostle Ancestor No. 13. His real name was Zepia Eltnam Oberon, an alchemist from Atlas. 

Has the power to grant physical form to fears using his Reality Marble, [b]The Night of Wallachia[/b]. He has no definite form, although he was commonly seen in the form of a traditional [[vampire]].

h4. Appearance

body:

A relic in the shape of a [[black crown|black]] [[crown]]. [spoilers]Originally known as DWDB-221E, created by the "Previous Civilization" to record their history[/spoilers], later ends up in the hands of the Teekaz and becomes the symbol of "Lords of Fiends" the king of Sarkaz.

Originally appeared in-gameplay as one of the collectibles in Integrated Strategies [i]Ceobe's Fungimist[/i]. [spoilers]And later on as a playable Supporter "Operator", in [[Theresa (arknights)|]]'s visage[/spoilers].

title: blizzard
body:
A blizzard is a severe [[winter]] [[snowstorm]] characterized by strong winds and low visibility. It should not look pleasant. Roughly 45 degree or greater for incoming snow and/or strong visible winds blowing already fallen snow (ground blizzard).

Not to be confused with [[Blizzard Entertainment]].

title: onahole_job_invitation
body:
When a character is suggesting the promise of an [[onahole job]] or enticing someone into being the recipient of an [[onahole job]]. This tag also applies when a character tells someone else to give them an [[onahole job]].

This most often takes the form of a [[naughty face]] and making eye contact in conjunction with a strategically [[lubrication|lubricated]] [[artificial vagina]], sometimes to the point of spilling and oozing out, leaving a trail of [[lube|lubricant]], and/or showing the opening of the [[artificial vagina]], sometimes spreading it open.

title: aleksander_ryback
body:
Aleksander Ryback (アレクサンダー・ライバック), better known as Kalman III and nicknamed Alek, is the third generation and current North God of the North God Style. He is the grandson of [[Atoferatofe Rybak]] and the son of Kalman II, also known as [spoiler][[Sandor von Grandeur]][/spoiler], Alek is the current wielder of Kajakut, a legendary sword, and is ranked seventh among the Seven Great Powers.

Aleksander is a determined person. Due to the way he was raised, he is obsessed with becoming a hero and surpassing his father. To achieve such a goal, he did everything in his power to gain fame among the public.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31800651
* !asset #31800652
* !asset #31800653
* !asset #31800654

title: sandor_von_grandeur
body:
Sandor, also known as Alex C. Rybak or Kalman II, is a legendary figure in the epic of the North God. He is the son of Kalman I, the original North God, and the Demon King [[Atoferatofe Rybak]], and the father of [[Aleksander Ryback]] known as Kalman III, being part of a lineage of great power and equal fame. Renowned for his many heroic feats, Sandor rose to fame as one of the greatest swordsmen in history. Once considered the strongest swordsman in the world and a former member of the Seven Great Powers, his reputation remains formidable—even though he no longer possesses his most powerful weapon and is no longer officially ranked among the Great Powers. Despite this, he continues to stand as one of the most powerful swordsmen alive, a symbol of strength, legacy, and extraordinary mastery.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31734551
* !asset #31734556

h4. External links

title: tetino_kassebaum
body:
A fanmade derivative of [[Kasane Teto]] made by [[spielzeug]]. She seems to be inspired by witches from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]]. Tetino has pure [[white skin]], short [[red hair]] styled in her iconic [[twin drills]] and a [[huge ahoge]], an [[animal nose]], and [[multicolored eyes]] styled in a spiral pattern. Tetino has a red [[demon tail]] near her back. Tetinos outfit is similar to that of a marching band. 

Tetino's attire includes a grey sideways [[shako cap]], a [[grey jacket]] with [[red trim]], oversized sleeves, [[gold buttons]], and gold [[epaulettes]], a belt that's buckled at the front, [[grey pants]], and tall black [[latex boots]]. On her back she wears a [[black cape]] with a [[skull print]] on the back, and red [[diamond print]] on the inside of her cape.

title: hitogami_(mushoku_tensei)
body:
A key character in [[Mushoku Tensei]]. He is a mysterious, entirely white figure who appears in a completely blank and empty world within [[Rudeus Greyrat]]'s dreams. He offers advice in a laid-back and casual manner, never revealing his true intentions. His motivations and backstory remain shrouded in mystery, adding to his enigmatic presence.

title: orsted_(mushoku_tensei)
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. The Dragon God and the second-ranked among the Seven Great Powers. He is the sworn enemy of [[Hitogami (Mushoku Tensei)|]] and his deep hatred toward him leads Orsted to attack [[Rudeus Greyrat]] upon discovering that Rudeus has been in contact with Hitogami.

A mysterious and overwhelmingly powerful figure, Orsted instills fear in those around him with his mere presence. It is said that, were it not for the curses placed upon him, he would possess the strength to destroy the world.

title: leo_(mushoku_tensei)
body:
Leo is a Sacred Beast born from the Sacred Tree, revered by the Doldia Tribe as a mythical protector destined to appear once every few centuries. These rare creatures emerge only during times of great crisis, fated to join a hero and use their immense power to help save the world.

Years after rescuing Leo from a magical barrier created by kidnappers, [[Rudeus Greyrat]] summoned him to protect his family. From that moment, Leo took on the role of guardian of the Greyrats, with a future mission to accompany [[Lara Greyrat]], Rudeus’s daughter, on her journey as a hero.

title: reida_reia
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. The Water God in the Water God Style, one of the three main sword styles in [[Mushoku Tensei]]. She is the grandmother of [[Isolte Cruel]], and a legendary swordswoman known for her mastery and discipline.

Reida traveled to the Holy Land of the Swords with two purposes: to train [[Eris Greyrat]], a promising young warrior, and to make Isolte face the sword god style as a method of strengthening her through combat. Her presence in the Holy Land marked a pivotal moment for both Eris and Isolte, pushing them to grow under her intense and refined tutelage.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31720408: Old
* !asset #31720447: Young

title: nina_farion
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. The daughter of the current Sword God and a ranked Sword Saint from the Holy Land of Swords. she challenged [[Eris Greyrat]] upon her arrival—but was swiftly defeated and brutally beaten. Fueled by resentment, Nina set out for Ranoa with the intent to capture [[Rudeus Greyrat]], hoping to use him as a tool to humiliate Eris, who held him in high regard.

However, her plans unraveled when she witnessed Rudeus defeat the Demon King with a single blow—the same foe who had previously crushed her. Shocked by his strength and the level Eris aspired to reach, Nina reconsidered her path. She resumed her training with renewed determination and eventually became both a rival and sparring partner to Eris and [[Isolte Cruel]], forming a lasting friendship with them.

h4. Appearance

title: perugius_dola
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. Perugius Dola is known as the Armored Dragon King, a high-ranking member of the Dragon Tribe and one of the legendary Seven Great Heroes who sealed away the Demon God Laplace 500 years ago. Among these heroes was Kalman I, the father of Kalman II, also known as [spoiler][[Sandor Von Grandeur]][/spoiler]

He gained fame after reconstructing the ancient floating sky castle Chaos Breaker, which now serves as his residence as he awaits the Demon God's revival. His heroic actions during the war were so impactful that the post-war period was named the Armored Dragon Era in his honor.

Perugius also possesses the rare ability to summon 11 ancient spirits, each with immense intelligence and magical power. These spirits remain with him for as long as he lives. Among them is Almanfi, a distinguished spirit who serves as his loyal attendant and messenger.

h4. Appearance

title: paul_greyrat
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. Paul Greyrat is a S ranked adventurer and a former member of the party Fangs of the Black Wolf, which previously included Zenith, [[Ghislaine Dedoldia]], Geese, Tallhand, and [[Elinalise Dragonroad]]. After the party disbanded, Paul married [[Zenith Greyrat]] and had [[Rudeus Greyrat]]. He later married [[Lillia Greyrat]], with whom he had [[Aisha Greyrat]] around the same time [[Norn Greyrat]] was born.

Skilled in all three sword styles, Paul dedicated himself to searching for the missing and reuniting with his family following the Mana Disaster. This mission lasted for years and eventually led him to form a rescue team alongside Rudeus and several former companions to explore the Teleportation Labyrinth.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #31946978

* !asset #31946991
* !asset #31946992

title: norn_greyrat
body:
[[Mushoku Tensei]] character. The daughter of [[Paul Greyrat]] and [[Zenith Greyrat]], sister of [[Aisha Greyrat]], and the younger sister of [[Rudeus Greyrat]]. She is a devoted follower of Saint Millis. Currently, she is a student at Ranoa, where she managed to reconcile with her brother after years of tension between them, which had been worsened by comparisons between the two — but has since been resolved

title: michael_roa_valdamjong
body:
A character from [[Tsukihime]]. The unofficial 28th of the 27 Dead Apostles Ancestors, nicknamed [b]The Serpent of Akasha[/b] and [b]The Infinite Reincarnator[/b], he's the antagonist and the root of the chaos in the story. 

The eternal enemy of [[Arcueid Brunestud]] and [[Ciel (Tsukihime)]], he became a dead apostle for the sole goal of "seeking eternity" to obtain infinite knowledge beyond his human lifespan.

In the [[Melty Blood]] series he is a reoccurring manifestation of [[Night of Wallachia|]].

One of his reincarnations appears in [[Fate/Grand Order]]'s supplementary material named [[Tarantella (Fate)|]].

A young slender male, with flowing long [[black hair]] and [[red eyes]]. Almost always seen wearing an white [[open shirt]] that reveals his torso. Sometimes wrapped in [[bandages]].

In the [[Tsukihime (remake)|Tsukihime Remake]], he changes his long hair to a slicked hair back one instead

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24287285: Original
* !post #8194436: Remake

title: ailis_(anilive)
body:
Mascot of [[AniLive]]. Character design by [[SHOKUEN (oxstl)|]].

Prior to becoming AniLive's mascot, she was the mascot for [[IZUMO LAB]]. Her voice is available as a [[CoeFont]] voicebank.

Since she didn't become AniLive's mascot until 2024, all artworks posted prior to April 16, 2024 are eligible to have the IZUMO LAB copyright.

She has [[long hair|long]] [[white hair]] with [[headphones]], [[yellow eyes]], a [[yellow shirt|yellow]] [[backless shirt]] with a [[clothing cutout|cutout]], [[see-through sleeves|see-through]] [[puffy long sleeves|puffy long]] [[detached sleeves]] [[grey pants]], and [[white boots]].

title: marlene_wallace
body:
[[Final Fantasy VII]] character.

[[Barret Wallace]]'s daughter who runs the bar in Midgar when he and [[Tifa Lockhart]] are working in AVALANCHE.

[spoiler]Marlene is Barret's adopted daughter. Her real father is Dyne, who was assumed dead. Dyne becomes insane and says that he would kill Marlene in order to reunite her with her dead mother.[/spoiler]

title: arle_nadja
body:
[[Madou Monogatari]] and [[Puyopuyo]] character, often accompanied by the yellow rabbit-like creature [[Carbuncle (puyopuyo)|]].

She has [[brown hair|brown]] or [[orange hair]] styled in a [[ponytail]]. Her official outfit typically includes a [[white shirt]], [[blue skirt]] and [[blue boots]], with the exception of her [[school uniform]].

In Madou Monogatari, she is a 6-year old girl who has to defeat monsters to graduate from kindergarten. In Puyopuyo, she is 16 years old.

She's currently voiced by [[Sonozaki Mie]] in Japanese and [[Erica Mendez]] in English. She was voiced by [[Mitsuishi Kotono]] in [[PC Engine]] ports of the games.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #23079185: [[Puyopuyo]]
* !asset #22950406: [[Puyopuyo~n]]
* !asset #23079115: [[Puyopuyo Fever]] 1 and [[Puyopuyo Fever 2]]
* !asset #23079125: [[Puyopuyo 7]]
* !asset #23079298: [[Puyopuyo 20th Anniversary]]

title: snow_sugar_cookie
body:
[[Cookie Run]] character.

They have [[short hair|short]] [[white hair]] and [[purple eyes|purple]] or [[blue eyes]].  Their default outfit includes [[earmuffs]] and a [[blue coat|blue]] [[fur-trimmed coat]]. They are often depicted with a [[staff]].

They debuted in the original Cookie Run for Kaokao on January 1st 2014. Their Japanese VA is [[Fujita Akane (voice_actor)|]].

title: mononoke
body:
Occult detective TV series, spin-off from [[Ayakashi: Japanese Classic Horror]].

It follows [[Kusuriuri (Mononoke)|]] from Ayakashi's Bake Neko arc as he travels and eliminates different mononoke by solving the cases which has leaded to their creation and cutting them with his [[sword of exorcism]].

The movie trilogy, [[Gekijouban Mononoke]], is set in the same world but follows different characters.

h4. Characters

title: freedom_of_speech
body:
A 1943 painting by [[Norman Rockwell]]. The painting depicts a man standing up at a town meeting to speak his mind. The painting is now often used as a [[meme]] format for characters voicing an unpopular opinion.

h4. Examples

* !asset #23176645

h4. External links

title: ikusaba_mukuro
body:
A character from [[Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc]], titled the Ultimate Soldier (超高校級の「軍人」).

She is the [[twins|twin]] [[sisters|sister]] of [[Enoshima Junko]]. She dresses up as her sister and impersonates her at the start of the killing game. She has [[freckles]] and wears a [[rabbit hair ornament]] and a [[red bow]] / [[white bow]] when she dresses like Junko.

title: hauchiwa
body:
A magical [[feather fan]], commonly possessed by [[Tengu]]. Hauchiwa may resemble a maple leaf, but they are not actually made of leaves.

In folk tales, these fans sometimes have the ability to grow or shrink a person's nose, but usually they are attributed the power to stir up great winds.

[[Shameimaru Aya]] from [[Touhou]] is one of the more notable hauchiwa-possessing characters, and is frequently depicted with one. While hauchiwa typically have a vaguely leaf-like appearance anyway, Aya's resembles a [[maple leaf]] (down to its coloring and use of fewer feathers in order to specifically achieve a leaf-like shape).

Do not tag hauchiwa with [[leaf fan]], as the former is not made out of leaves, despite some hauchiwa having superficially similar appearance to a maple leaf.

Some Tengu characters may carry an actual [[leaf fan]] instead of a hauchiwa, e.g. [[Kurama (urusei_yatsura)|]] from [[Urusei Yatsura]]. Tag these examples as [[leaf fan]] instead of [[hauchiwa]], as they are not made out of feathers.

body:

Has [[long hair|long]] and [[big hair|voluminous]] [[blonde hair]] worn in [[twintails]] and [[blue eyes]]. Wears a [[necktie]] and [[school uniform]], usually open enough to expose her [[cleavage]]. title: vivian_banshee
body:
A character from [[Zenless Zone Zero]]. Member of the Mockingbird, despite her noble-like appearance, she is known to be working on several part-time jobs.

She is a hardcore fan of the Proxy "Phaethon", although she only learned that they were in fact two individuals ([[Belle (zenless zone zero)|]] and [[Wise_(zenless zone zero)|]]) when she first met them.

She is voiced in Japanese by [[Mizuno Saku]].

She has [[long hair|long]] [[green hair]], styled into [[twintails]] with [[sphere hair ornament]], [[braided sidelock]]s, [[blunt bangs]], [[green eyes]] and [[small breasts]]. Her standard outfit consists of a [[sleeveless]] [[black shirt|black]] [[crop top|cropped top]], [[black gloves|black]] [[elbow gloves|elbow-length]] [[fingerless gloves]], [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]], [[knee pads]], [[black socks|black]] [[stirrup legwear|stirrup]] [[kneehighs]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[sneakers]]. He has [[medium hair|medium-length]] [[grey hair]] [[hair over one eye|covering his right eye]], [[orange eyes]], [[jackal ears]], and [[dark-skinned male|dark skin]]. body:
A playable [[Genshin Impact]] character who made his debut on Version 3.0 along with his home nation, Sumeru. Voiced by [[Kobayashi Sanae]] (JP) and [[Zachary Gordon]] (EN). His original design is by [[pako (pakosun)]].

He is portrayed with [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[green hair|green]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], [[fox ears]] and [[fox tail|tail]], and [[green eyes]]. His default outfit consists of a [[black shirt|black]] [[hooded shirt]] with [[asymmetrical sleeves]] (short on left, long on right), outer layer [[hadanugi dousa]] [[white shirt]], [[purple belt]], [[black gloves]], [[black pants|black]] [[baggy pants]], and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots]]. 

His signature weapon is [[Hunter's Path (Genshin Impact)|Hunter's Path]].

title: qiqi_(genshin_impact)
body:
[[Genshin Impact]] character. An apprentice and herb gatherer at Bubu Pharmacy.

"Blessed" by the adepti with a body that cannot die, this petite [[jiangshi]] cannot do anything without first giving herself orders to do it. Qiqi's memory is like a sieve. Out of necessity, she always carries around a notebook in which she writes anything important that she is sure to forget later. But on her worst days, she even forgets to look at her notebook...

Her name is pronounced [b]Nana[/b] in the Japanese version of the game.

h4. Appearance

title: scaramouche_(genshin_impact)
body:
A character in [[Genshin Impact]]. His playable incarnation is the [[Wanderer (genshin impact)|]].

First appearing in the "Unreconciled Stars" event, he is later revealed to be sixth of the eleven Fatui Harbingers. In Act 3, Chapter II of the Archon Quest [spoilers]his true name is discovered to be Kunikuzushi[/spoiler].

Like the other Fatui Harbingers, he is named after a stock character in the Italian theater genre "Commedia dell'arte":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commedia_dell%27arte].

title: venti_(genshin_impact)
body:
A playable Anemo character in [[Genshin Impact]]. A [[bard]] that seems to have arrived on some unknown wind — sometimes sings songs as old as the hills, and other times sings poems fresh and new.

His true identity is the human form of the Anemo Archon [[Barbatos (genshin impact)|]]. His [[Vision (genshin impact)|]] is just a glass ball he carries around to alleviate suspicion.

He has a similar appearance to the [[Nameless Bard (genshin impact)|]], whose guise he took after becoming the Anemo Archon, as well as to [[Wendy (Honkai Impact)|]] from [[Honkai Impact 3rd]].

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] with [[twin braids]]. In his default outfit he wears a [[green hat|green]] [[beret]], [[green cape|cape]], and [[green shorts|shorts]], with [[white pantyhose]] and [[black footwear|black]] [[loafers]]. He carries a [[lyre]].

In his [[Venti (Archon) (Genshin Impact)|Archon]] form he wears a very revealing [[midriff]]-exposing [[crop top]] and a [[hooded capelet]]. He also wears elbow-length [[bridal gauntlets]], along with [[short shorts]] and a [[single thighhigh]]. The outfit is overall predominantly white. He also has white [[feathered wings]].

His signature weapon is [[Elegy of the End (Genshin Impact)|]].

h4. Appearance

title: master_sword
body:
The Master Sword, also known as the "Blade of Evil's Bane" is [[Link]]'s iconic weapon in [[The Legend of Zelda]] series. It was forged by the Ancient Sages to vanquish beings of evil who would use the [[Triforce]] to wicked ends, and can only be wielded by those who are pure of heart and strong of body.

The Master Sword is a double-edged [[long sword]] with no fuller (central blade groove), and either a purple, gold or blue hilt, depending on the game. The hilt has a noticeably large cross-guard in relation to the pommel, and interestingly, it is somewhat reminiscent to the seal of the royal family. The blade has a large ricasso (unsharpened blade portion near the hilt suitable for a second grip), although Link is never portrayed using it in any of the games. Engraved on the blade is the Triforce, and embedded in the cross-guard is what appears to be a yellow gemstone.

h4. Examples

* !post #971512

h4. See also

* [[sword]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: implied_cuntboy
body:
When a character in the image seems to be a [[cuntboy]], but it's not 100% certain.

Whether the character is canonically a cuntboy or not, whether related pictures have a pussy showing or not, and whether the artist clarifies that it is cuntboy or not aren't relevant. So long as it cannot be confirmed visually, this tag can be used.

This tag can overlap with [[cuntboy]] for the sake of usability and blacklisting, due to tags like [[cuntboy with female]]/[[cuntboy with male]].

title: matikanefukukitaru_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]].

The fortune-telling [[horse girl]] with a really long name (read as [i]Machikane Fukukitaru[/i]), Matikanefukukitaru is obsessed with fortune and luck and collects a wild range of lucky charms. The other horse girls (and humans at times) often consult her with their luck as well. She often refers to a "Shiraoki-sama" as if they were a [[shinto]] deity (and indeed, a horse named Shiraoki is the real life horse's fifth generation mare line ancestor).

Her name, when read as a whole, roughly means "Good fortune comes to those who wait".

The real life horse's name was originally intended to be "Machikane Fukukitaru", but it was shortened to "Matikanefukukitaru" because of a maximum 18 letter limit on the international rules for racehorse names. Here, Machikane/Matikane is a [i]kanmei[/i] and many of the owner's horses have limit-filling names like these (See [[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]] as well).

h4. Appearance

* !post #3076130: [[Tracen School Uniform]]
* !post #7607563: [[Matikanefukukitaru (Rising Fortune) (Umamusume)|Rising Fortune]] 
* !post #3076131: [[Matikanefukukitaru (Rising Fortune) (Umamusume)|Rising Fortune]] (Draft)
* !post #6146343: [[starting future (umamusume)|Starting Future]]
* !post #5346645: [[Matikanefukukitaru (Casual) (Umamusume)|Casual]]
* !post #5119503: [[matikanefukukitaru (chance encounters can be a blessing) (umamusume)|Chance Encounters can be a Blessing]]
* !post #6212439: [[matikanefukukitaru_(good_omen_first_storm)_(umamusume)|Good Omen First Storm]]

h4. Related characters

* [[Matikanetannhauser (umamusume)|]] - Roommate, same owner
* [[Meisho Doto (umamusume)|]] - Friend, assistant in her fortune-telling ventures in the anime as well as frequent customer.
* [[Silence Suzuka (umamusume)|]] - Another frequent customer (In real life, she defeated Suzuka despite the huge distance gap)
* [[Taiki Shuttle (umamusume)|]] - Contemporary 
* [[Copano Rickey (umamusume)|]] - Fellow lucky-themed horse girl. Fukukitaru often consults her about luck advices. (Rickey being a Feng Shui practitioner and Fukukitaru; a hoarder of lucky charms, their methods often clash in fanart.)

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Official Character Bio: Matikanefukukitaru":[https://umamusume.jp/character/matikanefukukitaru]

title: film_grain
body:
A grainy, sand-like texture that appears in traditional film photography. Artists sometimes simulate film grain for artistic effect, especially to achieve a cinematic or [[retro artstyle|retro]] look.

This tag includes both traditional analog film grain and digital camera sensor noise.

h4. See also

* [[chromatic aberration]]
* [[heavy film grain]]
* [[lens flare]]
* [[adversarial noise]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Film grain":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Film_grain]
* "Wikipedia: Image noise":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Image_noise]

title: lying_on_person
body:
A character resting on another character.

For where someone is on another person but not [[lying]] on them, use [[on person]] instead.

For where someone is leaning above another person but not directing lying on them, instead supporting themselves with arms, in an intend to block the other person, use [[yukadon]] instead.

See {{animal_on_*}} for animals lying on a person.

h4. See also

* [[yukadon]]
* [[on person]]
* [[on lap]]
* [[lap pillow]]
* [[lying on lap]]
* [[sitting on person]]
* [[leaning on person]] 
* [[sleeping on person]]

body:

Voiced by [[Shinoda Minami]].

body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]]. A member of the Seven Crowns.

His name in the real world is Rajikumar Rajnikanth.

title: masaki_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from [[Princess Connect!]]. [[Neneka (Princess Connect!)|]]'s Princess Knight.

His name in the real world is Gurumazaki Masaki.

body:

She is voiced by [[Suzaki Aya]].

title: violet_(princess_connect!)
body:
A character from Princess Connect! Re:Dive (she did not appear in the original [[Princess Connect!]]).

She has long [[purple hair]] & [[hair between eyes]], [[purple eyes]], and breasts. She wears a hair ornament, big heart ornament on breasts, a black and white frilled dress, black gloves.

Voiced by [[Naganawa Maria]].
other_names: ヴァイオレット(プリコネ)

Her name in the real world is [[grace (real) (princess connect!)|Yuuno Kasuri]].

Voiced by [[Tomita Miyu]].

h4#holoJP. Hololive (original branch, a.k.a. hololive Japan)

h5#holoJP-gen0. Hololive Generation 0

title: watson_amelia
body:
A former [[Virtual Youtuber|VTuber]], and member of [[hololive English]]'s 1st generation, [[holoMyth]]. Designed by [[Nabi (UZ02)|]].

A [[detective]] time traveler with a [[Sherlock Holmes]] motif. Refers to herself as "Amelia Watson" to make her name sound more natural for English-speaking viewers. Also known as "Ame" for short.

She has [[medium hair|medium]] [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], hiding [[large breasts|a sizable bust]] under the layers of clothing. Her default hairstyle is a [[bob cut]] with a monocle [[hair ornament]].

Despite being called "the most normal-looking" and "oddball" out of the other [[HoloMyth]] debut (due to her not being a monster girl), she is actually the most chaotic of the bunch. She also likes to make jokes and banter, giving rise to her connection with the [[ground pound]] meme.

Her mascot and pet dog [[Bubba (watson amelia)|]] can occasionally be heard during her streams. She also has a pet cat named [[Wellington (watson amelia)|]].

Due to their frequent collaborations and chemistry both in videos and on Twitter, it is common to see her coupled with [[Gawr Gura]], a ship known as "AmeSame". Fans were quick to also compare her to [[Akai Haato]] due to their similar chaotic nature, which extends to collabs.

She reached one million subscribers on February 11 (JST) / 10 (PST) 2021.

Her general activities ended on September 30th, 2024, but she did not fully "graduate" and is still affiliated with Cover Corp, participating in future projects.

title: iono_(pokemon)
body:
A digital influencer and streamer who is the [[Gym Leader]] of Levincia's Gym in [[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon sv|Scarlet and Violet]]. She specializes in Electric-type [[pokemon (creature)|Pokémon]]. Known as [b]Nanjamo[/b] in Japan. Her Japanese name is a reference to the phrase "nan ja mon ja" which is a name given to an unusually large tree that grows in a particular place; literally meaning "What is it?".

title: yume_nikki
body:
A surreal exploration [[horror (theme)|]] game created in [[RPG Maker|RPG Maker 2003]] by [i]Kikiyama[/i]. 

The player wanders around a variety of dream worlds as a little girl, dubbed [[Madotsuki]] by the game menu. The only objective is to search for new "effects", such as a kitchen [[knife]] which one can stab others with, a [[witch hat]] and [[broom]] which can be used to fly, the ability to grow [[cat ears]], etc. The game has no dialogue or story, though it does have an ending which can be viewed when all the effects have been gathered.

On February 23, 2018, a 3D remake/reboot titled [[Yume Nikki Dream Diary]] was released on Steam.

title: kankaku_shadan
body:
[b]Kankaku shaden[/b] (lit. "[[Sensory deprivation]]" or "Sense blocking pit") is a fetish consisting of a character falling into a [[tentacle pit]] and being [[tentacle sex|ravaged by tentacles]], while being [[clueless]] of what's happening to them due to having their senses cut off, usually by either magic or paralyzing poison.

Often includes a follow up where the sensory nulling ends for one reason or another, which causes the victim to be forced to feel intense senses of overwhelming pleasure all at once. [[Breast expansion]] and [[inflation]] are often present as well.

The fetish originates from post #6364507 by [[Shirabe Shiki]], which also gives the fetish its name.

In rare cases when a [[tentacle pit]] is not involved but the setting is otherwise similar, the tag is still applicable.

h4. See also

* [[sensory deprivation]]
* [[tentacle pit]]
* [[tentacle sex]]
* [[emotionless sex]]

title: shauntal_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Shauntal[/b], known as [b]Shikimi[/b] (シキミ) in Japan, is a character introduced in [i][[pokemon|Pokémon]] [[pokemon bw|Black and White]][/i].

While she is one of the Unova Pokémon League's Elite Four, she is also a novelist who sometimes uses Trainers who challenge her as material for her books.

She has [[purple eyes]] and [[purple hair]] with [[blunt bangs]]. She wears [[glasses]], a [[purple dress]], [[black pantyhose]], [[mary janes]], and carries a [[book]] and [[pen]].

title: spitroast
body:
A variation of [[double penetration]] where the person in-between is performing [[oral]] sex or [[paizuri]] on a second person while being penetrated from behind. May or may not be standing, in [[seiza]], [[all fours]], [[arm support]] or [[grabbing another's arm]], etc. Generally features a female in the middle, surrounded by men (but not exclusively, see [[male spitroast]]).

Use this tag along with [[anal]] or [[vaginal]] when you're able to tell where the recipient is being penetrated. Not to be used when penetrated both anally and vaginally - in this case, use [[triple penetration]] or [[double penetration]] instead.

Named for the way a chicken is roasted inside a rotisserie.

For cooking food on a spit, see [[rotisserie]].

title: fantasy
body:
A genre of fiction that commonly uses [[magic]] and other supernatural phenomena as a primary element of plot, theme, or setting.

Fantasy settings often draw upon historical settings and costume, but subvert them in unrealistic ways, such as adding mystical or supernatural elements like mythology, magic, fictional creatures and unhistorical components.

title: danganronpa_3_(anime)
body:
[b]Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope's Peak Academy[/b] (ダンガンロンパ３ –The End of 希望ヶ峰学園–) is a TV anime series that aired for 25 episodes starting on July 2016, which is being directed by Seiji Kishi at Lerche. It is advertised as the final chapter of the Hope's Peak Saga of the first two games in [[Danganronpa (series)|]].

The anime was split into two Arcs; [i]Side: Future[/i], which told the story of the Future Foundation members being forced into one last Killing Game, and and [i]Side: Despair[/i], which shows how the 77th class of Hope's Peak fell into despair. Both series wrapped up with a finale episode, titled [i]Side: Hope[/i].

Not to be confused with [[Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony]].

Characters appearing in the [i]Side: Despair[/i] Arc generally wear the [[Hope's Peak Academy School Uniform]].

title: threesome
body:
A form of [[group sex]] involving exactly three people at the same time.

A threesome is not an [[orgy]] or a [[gangbang]]. An [[orgy]] involves multiple couples of groups or people having sex. A [[gangbang]] is three or more people having sex with a single person.

For the purposes of threesome tags, [[futanari]] are not counted as "female", but as "D" (dickgirl) instead. Likewise, [[cuntboy]] and [[male futanari]] are counted as "C" (cuntboy).

title: dark_souls_(series)
body:
Dark Souls is a trilogy of action role-playing games directed by [[Miyazaki Hidetaka]] of [[FromSoftware]] and published by [[Bandai Namco]]. The series began with the release of [[Dark Souls I]] and has seen two sequels, [[Dark Souls II]] and [[Dark Souls III]]. The Dark Souls series is the spiritual successor to [[Demon's Souls]].

Dark Souls takes place in the fictional kingdom of Lordran, where players assume the role of a cursed undead character who begins a pilgrimage to discover the fate of their kind. The player fights against knights, dragons, phantoms, demons, and other monstrous or supernatural entities. The accretion, loss, and recovery of souls are central to the narrative and gameplay of Dark Souls games. These games are linked through their setting and an overarching cyclic narrative centering around fire. At the end of each game, characters may reignite the "first flame" or allow it to fade, recurring a choice others have made before.

title: super_sonico
body:
The [[mascot]] character of "NITRO SUPER SONIC", annual live events held by the company [[Nitroplus]]. She made her debut in 2006 and she was designed by [[Tsuji Santa]]. She is the vocalist and guitarist of the band "[i]Daiichi Uchuu Sokudo[/i]" (第一宇宙速度, First Cosmic Velocity) and the other members are bassist [[Fujimi Suzu]] and drummer [[Watanuki Fuuri]].

Sonico is rather shy and clumsy, but nevertheless kind, bubbly, energetic and positive no matter what. Her usual (and most known) outfit consist of a [[casual]] [[blouse]] with a cat printed on it, as well as a [[blue hoodie|blue]] [[hoodie]], and a [[fur-trimmed skirt|fur-trimmed]] [[miniskirt]]. She is never seen without her trademark [[headphones]]. While her physical features depend on the artist, she is consistently depicted with large, [[tareme]] [[red eyes]], light [[pink hair]] and very [[large breasts]].

Her height is 158cm, and her measurements are 90F-57-87. Her birthday is October 14th.

On June 30th, 2018, Sonico "announced":https://twitter.com/sonico_macaron/status/1012578566343573504 her debut as a [[virtual youtuber]], which lasted until January 2020. Her redesign consists of a [[pink jacket|pink]] and [[white jacket|white]] [[letterman jacket]], her trademark cat blouse or a [[camisole]] (depending on what kind of straps are on her shoulders), a [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], a pair of [[black thighhighs]], and a pair of [[black footwear|black]] [[lace-up boots|lace-up]] [[high heel boots]].

Sonico has a brother figure and male counterpart in [[nitro+CHiRAL]]'s mascot [[Naitou-kun]].

title: gotland_(kancolle)
body:
[[Kantai Collection]]'s personification of the Swedish seaplane cruiser HSwMS [i]Gotland[/i]. Designed by [[drew (drew213g)|Drew]].

She has [[long_hair|long]] grayish [[blue hair]] tied into a [[single hair bun]] and a [[mole under eye|mole under her left eye]]. She wears a [[military uniform]] consisting of an overcoat, a shirt with a [[blue sailor collar]] and [[black neckerchief]], and a [[blue skirt]] with yellow stripe (the colors of the [[Swedish flag]]). Completing the outfit are [[half gloves|short]] [[white gloves]], a [[dirk]] in a [[thigh strap]], mid-shin [[socks]] and [[rudder footwear]]. Her rigging includes a [[smokestack]], a single [[ship turret]] at her right side and a short landing pad for seaplanes at her left. 

Being the only Swedish shipgirl, she is often portrayed with distinctive Swedish things ([[surstromming|surströmming]] for example). She is also associated with [[sheep]]. This is probably due to her namesake island's coat of arms depicting a ram. Due to her unusually friendly and casual attitude with the [[Admiral (Kancolle)|]], she is often portrayed as "manipulating them and the shipgirls to think she was there since the beginning":[/pools/14729]. This personality trait likely stems from the fact that Swedes are generally very casual with others, even those of a higher rank or standing, in contrast to the more formal Japanese.

The historical [i]Gotland[/i] did not see any active combat during [[World War II]] due to Sweden's official stance of neutrality. She became known for spotting [[Bismarck (kancolle)|]] as the latter broke out of the Baltic Sea, leading to the "final battle of Bismarck":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_battle_of_the_battleship_Bismarck]. [i]Gotland[/i] survived the war and was scrapped in 1963.

title: danganronpa_(series)
body:
A video game and media franchise created by Spike Chunsoft. The game has often been described as a mix between [i][[Ace Attorney]][/i] and [i][[Battle Royale]][/i]. [[Komatsuzaki Rui]] is the official illustrator.

The main games are each set in a high school where students are forced to participate in a "killing game", where one student must kill another student without being caught to be allowed to leave, while the others must deduce who the killer was to prevent themselves from being executed in their place.

[b]Victor Company of Japan, Ltd[/b] (日本ビクター株式会社 [i]Nippon Bikutā Kabushiki-gaisha[/i]) (TYO: 6792), usually referred to simply as [b]Victor[/b] or [b]JVC[/b] in product labels, is a Japanese international consumer and professional electronics corporation based in Yokohama, Japan which was founded in 1927.

title: kotatsu
body:
A low [[table]] sandwiching a blanket and containing an electrical heating element underneath; with enough space to rest underneath for one or more people, depending on size. It is something of a wintertime necessity for the many Japanese homes that lack proper insulation for central heating systems. 

The consumption of [[mandarin orange|mandarin oranges]] is often a favorite activity of kotatsu users.

title: hornet_(hollow_knight)
body:
A recurring character in [[Hollow Knight]] and protagonist of its sequel [[Hollow Knight: Silksong|Silksong]], [b]Hornet[/b] is a mysterious [[red cloak|red-cloaked]] bug who clashes with [[knight_(hollow_knight)|The Knight]] on more than one occasion. She fights using a [[needle_(hollow_knight)|]] and thread.
[spoiler]She is the daughter of the [[Pale King (Hollow Knight)|Pale King]] and [[Herrah (Hollow Knight)|Herrah]], making her a [[half-siblings|half-sibling]] of the player character [[Knight (Hollow Knight)|Knight]] and the [[Hollow Knight (character)|Hollow Knight]] (this also means she is a [[spider]] rather than a [[wasp|hornet]]).[/spoiler]

title: calstone_light_o_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. A sprinter [[horse girl]] that pursues the path of "The Fastest". Her calm and collected exterior belies her straightforward personality, her love for [[cat]]s, as well as her obsession with straight lines.

She is notable as the first character based on a horse descended from Matchem's sire-line. This means that [[Godolphin Barb (umamusume)|]] finally has a direct descendant to cheer for, and hence why she repeatedly made appearances in her campaign.

The real [[Calstone Light O (Racehorse)|]] is notable for holding the Japanese record for 1000m (≈5 furlongs in US/UK terms) on Turf (53.7 seconds during the 2002 Ibis Summer Dash, in Niigata), which is the reason for the Umamusume version's obsession about becoming "the fastest". As the Ibis Summer Dash is one of very few straight races in Japan, she is also obsessed with going straight and straight lines in general, often to the point of spurning curves or anything that curves.

h4. Appearance

title: bamboo_memory_(umamusume)
body:
[[Umamusume]] character. Public Morals Committee Chairwoman (AKA Head Prefect, AKA [i]Fuuki Iinchou[/i]) of Tracen Academy. Voiced by [[Aihara Kotomi]]. 

Bamboo Memory is often depicted carrying around her namesake [[shinai]] (bamboo blade). This shinai is effectively her badge of office, lending her a certain air of authority.

Ironically, despite being the head of the student disciplinary committee, Bamboo speaks in a rough accent very reminiscent of Japanese (male) [[delinquent]]s.

title: rhein_kraft_(umamusume)
body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. The main character in the game's second main story, being part of the new team Ascella.

Historically, she is the winner of the 2005 Oka Sho and [[NHK Mile Cup]]. Unlike her rivals, the real horse never had the chance to go to into breeding, having died of a heart attack in August 2006, months after what ended up being her last race.

body:
Character from [[Umamusume]]. Voiced by [[Satou Haruka (voice actor)|]]. Notable for being the first Carrot Farm horse in the franchise. She is a focus character in the game's second main story, being part of the new team Ascella.

Personality-wise, she has very distinct "on" and "off" modes according to her roommate [[Rhein Kraft (umamusume)|]], switching from stoic and serious at work to a complete sweetheart at rest. This disparity is considered a [[gap moe]].

title: sweep_tosho_(platanus_witch)_(umamusume)
body:
The racing outfit of [[Umamusume]]'s [[Sweep Tosho (Umamusume)|]]. The name is the same in both JP and EN versions.


Befitting her [[witch]] persona, she wears a whimsical, witch-inspired ensemble featuring a dark, wide-brimmed [[witch hat]] adorned with purple inner. The main garment is a long, flowing [[black coat]] with purple lining and elaborate gold and red patterns on the lower half, worn over a [[red sweater vest]] and a white [[pleated skirt]] . Completing the look are black [[thigh boots]] [[white gloves]], and a [[black belt]] with a golden buckle.

title: byalant_custom
body:
A fictional military manned robot from the [[Gundam]]  [[mecha]] verse. It first appeared in [[Gundam Unicorn]].

[b]RX-160S Byarlant Custom[/b]

An [[Earth Federation]] highly modified, modernized version of the aerospace combat [[Byalant]] [[mobile_suit|MS]], incorporating multiple elements from various [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]] designs. Commanded by a veteran MS ace pilot who fought with the Titans, the unit devastated the invading "Sleeves" [[Neo Zeon]] forces at the Second Battle of Torrington.

title: titans_(gundam)
body:
A fictional military faction from the [[Gundam]] [[mecha]]verse.

[b]The Titans[/b] (ティターンズ [i]Titānzu[/i]) are the main antagonists of the [[Mobile Suit]] [[Zeta Gundam]] anime TV series. They are also featured in [[Gundam Sentinel]] and in [[Advance of Zeta]]: The Flag of Titans. 

They were an elite unit that the [[Earth Federation]] established in [[gundam 0083|U.C. 0083]] after the conclusion of [i]Operation Stardust[/i]. Their original intention was to defend the Earth Federation against supporters and military remnants of the Principality of [[Zeon]], as well as to investigate Zeon sympathizers. However, [spoilers]they employ brutal genocidal tactics against innocent spacenoid civilians from several colonies, what sparks the creation of [[military]] resistance groups like the [[space]] bound [[AEUG]] and the [[Earth (planet)|]] bound Karaba, as the conflict escalates into a full-blown civil [[war]] known as "The Gryps War".[/spoilers] 

[spoilers]The Titans' army eventually grew too big and turned rogue, allying themselves with [[neo zeon|Axis Zeon]] in order to fight against the Anti-Earth Union Group in an attempt to gain control over the Earth Sphere. They were all but wiped out by the AEUG at the end of the Gryps Conflict ([[gundam zz|U.C. 0088]]), while some of its very few surviving MS pilots joined [[Neo Zeon]] or the [[Earth Federation]].[/spoilers]

h4. Notable members

title: salute
body:
A gesture of greeting and respect, typically a hand raised in the air.

Salutes vary across countries and even within different branches of the military in the same country. American salutes consist of the forearm at a 45° angle to the forehead, with the blade hand with palm towards face. British salutes are similar, but with the palm facing outward. The [[straight-arm salute]] (also called the Roman or Nazi salute) has the arm extended straight out and upwards.

A salute should not be confused with simple [[waving]] or making the [[V]] sign.

h4. Examples

* !post #9965183: American salute
* !post #3287651: British salute
* !post #9448920: Zogist salute
* !post #9937104: [[Two-finger salute]]
* !post #67809: [[Straight-arm salute]]
* !post #1939673: [[Vulcan salute]]

h4. Related tags

* [[Two-finger salute]] 
* [[Three-finger salute]]
* [[Straight-arm salute]] 
* [[Super Earth Salute (Helldivers)|]] ([[Helldivers (Series)|]])
* [[Vulcan salute]]

h4. See also

* [[V]]
* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Salute":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Salute

title: two-finger_salute
body:
A gesture with the thumb, index and middle fingers extended and raised in front of the head as a form of [[salute|saluting]].

In Britain and other British Commonwealth countries, a "two-fingered salute" refers to an [[inward V]] gesture that is the equivalent of the [[middle finger]]. On Danbooru, a two-fingered salute is an actual [[salute]].

Not to be confused with [[kuji-in]], various [[ninja]] gestures that may involve extending the first two fingers, but not as a salute, nor with [[V]] or [[V over eye]], which have the fingers spread apart and are not salutes.

h4. Examples

* !post #9937104

* [[salute]]

* "Wikipedia: Two-finger salute":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Two-finger_salute

title: vulcan_salute
body:
A hand gesture consisting of a raised hand, palm forward with the fingers parted between the middle and ring finger, and the thumb extended, like this: 🖖. The gesture, primarily seen in the [[Star Trek]] series (usually used by [[Vulcan]] science officer [[Spock]]), was based on a priestly blessing used by "Jewish Kohanim":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kohen.

In the context of Danbooru, this is a variation of the [[v]] gesture.

h4. Examples

* !post #7792497
* !post #1939673

h4. See also

* [[\\//]]
* [[\||/]]
* [[Tag Group:Gestures]]

title: lalah_sune
body:
A female character from the [[Gundam]] series. She first appeared in [[Mobile Suit Gundam]] from 1979. 

[b]Lalah Sune[/b] is [[Char Aznable]]'s subordinate and [[Amuro Ray]]'s initial love interest. She has a [[bindi]] and was born in [[India]].

Lalah was forced to work in an Indian brothel in her youth, but was rescued by Char Aznable to whom she is fiercely loyal and forever in debt. She later becomes a very dangerous newtype [[Zeon]] ace pilot in her own right. Her [[mecha]] of choice is the [[Elmeth]]. 

[spoiler]She tragically dies during a pivotal [[space]] [[battle]], accidentaly killed by an unwilling Amuro while defending her savior and protector Char. This event would haunt both Amuro and Char for the rest of their lives.[/spoiler]

In the SD Gundam skits, she is shown having the business end of a beam saber for a bindi.

Also appears in [[Gundam GQuuuuuux]]. In this timeline she is not rescued by Char and remains a high class [[prostitute]]. However, she is still a newtype and senses the [[Elmeth]] from [[alternate_universe|another universe]] that has been in statsis underwater and was found by the Zeon forces. Lalah is eventually rescued by [[shirouzu_(gundam)|the GQuuuuuux Char Aznable]] at the end of the series.

h4. See also

* [[Is this the Rose of Sharon? (meme)]]: meme referencing the GQuuuuuux scene where the Elmeth is found in the ocean with Lalah in stasis inside.

title: st._paul's_cathedral
body:
An [[christianity|Anglican]] [[cathedral]] in [[London]], [[England]], the seat of the Bishop of London. Formerly known as the Cathedral [[Church]] of St. Paul the Apostle. Its construction was finished in 1710, consecrated in 1628. 

During World War II, the cathedral survived the Blitz although it was struck by German bombs on 10 October 1940 and 17 April 1941. The way it survived was captured as the iconic [i]St Paul's Survives[/i] photograph during the night air raid of 29–30 December 1940, illuminated by fires and surrounded by smokes of burning buildings.

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Real World Locations]]

title: tachi-e
body:
A [[straight-on|forward-facing]] style of character sprite popular in visual novels. They are commonly (but not always) [[full body]], [[standing]], and feature a [[simple background]].

Tachi-e originated as character art in [[visual novel]]s and adventure games. Often this is a [[looking at viewer|front-facing]] [[game cg|character sprite]] used during conversations with various prepared expressions and poses that can be switched as it flows. It does not strictly require your character to be standing, nor be [[full body]] (e.g. from the [[cowboy shot|knee]] or [[upper body|waist]] up), as long as art is reusable enough - it should qualify.

Aside from the regular tachi-e used in story mode, many gacha games' skin illustration will also have a tachi-e aesthetic, thus they sometimes also come with a [[faux figurine]] counterpart, usually being its evolved form. A clean character art removed from a faux figurine will also likely become a tachi-e if the character is standing, if they're sitting it's [[invisible chair]] instead.

When tagging, use the following rule of thumb: if you can slap an image onto the random background, add a textbox and the result will look like [[fake screenshot]] it should probably be considered a Tachi-e.

Tachi-e is [b]not[/b] applicable if image:

* Has more than one instance of the character ([[turnaround]]s, [[reference sheet]]s, [[multiple views]], [[variations]], [[multiple expressions]], etc...): post #3490670, post #2195716, post #3213462, post #2538995, post #2288278
* Has non [[simple background|simple]] or non [[transparent background]]s ([[zoom layer]]s, [[gradient background]], etc..): post #2925837 (vs post #2951458), post #4133229 (vs post #4133230), post #4028183, post #4151481
* Is a [[character profile]] or featuring character [[stats]]
* Is a [[faux figurine]] or a [[dakimakura (medium)|]]
* Has a tachi-e within [[screenshot]]s or [[fake screenshot]]s: post #818170,  post #1713628
* Has an extra [[outline]]: post #3589935 (vs post #3589913)

h4. Examples

* !post #2251995
* !post #1429310
* !post #3466244
* !post #2922420

h4. See also

* [[variant set]]
* [[tag group:image composition]]

h4. External Links

* "Nico Nico Pedia article":[https://dic.nicovideo.jp/a/立ち絵]
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia article":[https://dic.pixiv.net/a/立ち絵]

title: v
body:
Making a 'V' shape with the index and middle finger, like this: ✌️. Use [[W]] instead if the thumb is open too.

Most of the time it's simply a visual equivalent of "yo!", something you make when posing for pictures. It is sometimes called the "peace sign", "V sign", or "victory sign".

For the circular peace sign (☮), see [[peace symbol]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6074631
* !post #5974516: [[Gyaru V]]
* !post #5085332: [[Inward V]]

h4. Related tags

* [[V over eye]]
* [[V over mouth]]
* [[double V]]
* [[gyaru v]] (an upside-down v with the arm stretched out in front of the character)
* [[inward v]]
** [[double inward v]]
* [[bent v]]

h4. See also

* [[finger counting]]
* [[two-finger salute]]
* [[vulcan salute]]
* [[bunny ears prank]]
* [[W]] (three-fingered gestures, including V with the thumb out)
* [[middle W]] (three-fingered gesture with the index, middle and ring finger extended)
* [[\n/]] (aka "throwing horns")
* [[\m/]] (with the thumb out)
* [[l hand]] (two/three-fingered gesture involving the thumb, the index, and sometimes the middle finger)
* [[Tag group:gestures]]

title: inward_v
body:
A reversed [[V]] gesture, with palm facing inwards towards the body.

The British use this gesture as their equivalent to the [[middle finger]] gesture used by Americans. If the character holds the gesture over their mouth and puts their tongue through it, it may be a [[cunnilingus gesture]] as well.

h4. Examples

* !post #5085332
* !post #6850570

h4. See also

* [[inward w]]
* [[gyaru v]] (an upside-down V)

title: gyaru_v
body:
An upside-down [[V]] gesture, with the V pointing down and the palm facing out.

The gesture originates from Japan's [[Gyaru]] culture. The original term is called "Gyaru-peace", which is a combination of the Japanese pronunciation of "Gal," an English slang for women and girls, and the English word "Peace," which means the finger gesture [[V]].

h4. Examples

* !post #5974516

h4. See also

* [[double gyaru v]]
* [[gyaru w]]
* [[inward v]]

title: v_over_mouth
body:
Holding a [[v]]-shaped hand gesture over the mouth. If the fingers are over the corners of the mouth and [[tongue out|tongue is out]] in a [[sexually suggestive]] manner, it may be a [[cunnilingus gesture]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #5775684
* !post #9962652

title: cunnilingus_gesture
body:
A gesture where someone puts their [[tongue]] through an [[inward V]] sign [[v over mouth|over their mouth]], simulating [[cunnilingus]].

This gesture has different meanings in different cultures. When it's not obviously [[sexually suggestive]], use [[v over mouth]] and [[tongue out]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #8124144

h4. See also

* [[tribadism gesture]]
* [[penetration gesture]]
* [[Tag group:Gestures]]

title: iphone_14_pro
body:
[[Apple Inc.]]'s 16th generation [[iPhone]]. The iPhone 15 Pro is visually similar, the only differences being slightly thinner bezels and colors based on titanium.

h4. From the front

Features the "Dynamic Island":[https://support.apple.com/en-ca/guide/iphone/iph28f50d10d/ios] instead of a notch. The screen is trimmed with black, silver, gold, or purple.

h4. From the back

Like [[iPhone 13 Pro]], but purple.

h4. Example
* !asset #21493135: iPhone 14 Pro
* !asset #21493197: iPhone 15 Pro

title: iphone_11_pro
body:
Apple's 13th-generation flagship [[iphone|iPhone]], unveiled and first put on sale in 2019. Use only when the "distinct triple cameras":https://www.apple.com/ca/iphone-11-pro/specs/ on the back of the phone are visible, or if "iPhone 11 Pro" is explicitly mentioned.  Often used to show that a character is wealthy or high-class.

Visually identical to iPhone 11 Pro Max, as the size of the phone is ambiguous.

If there are just two cameras, use [[iphone 11]] instead.
If only the bezel-less front display is visible, use [[iphone x]] instead.

h4. Example
* !asset #21493037

title: tateyama_kenjirou
body:
A [[Kagerou Project]] character. [[father and daughter|Father]] of [[Tateyama Ayano]], husband of [[Tateyama Ayaka]], and the homeroom teacher of [[Kisaragi Momo]]. He formerly taught [[Kokonose Haruka]] and [[Enomoto Takane]] in a class for physically ill students. 

Kenjirou has [[brown hair|brown]], [[parted hair|parted]] [[short hair]], [[black eyes]] and a [[stubble]]. He is usually seen wearing  [[under-rim eyewear|under-rim]] [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[glasses]], a [[lab coat]], and a [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical-striped]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[red shirt]].

title: tateyama_ayaka
body:
A [[Kagerou Project]] character. Mother of [[Tateyama Ayano]] and the wife of [[Tateyama Kenjirou]]. Her occupation is an archaeologist. 

Ayaka has [[brown hair]] and dark [[brown eyes]]. Her hairstyle consists of [[ponytail]] with her bangs are being held in place by two red [[hairclip]]s. Ayaka's common outfit contains a [[black shirt]], a [[pink hoodie]] layered with a [[lab coat]] the same as Kenjirou's.

title: towa_no_yuugure
body:
An upcoming Fall 2025 anime, developed by [[P.A. Works]]. A high school student, [[Himegami Akira|Akira]], volunteers for a cryogenic experiment only to wake up 200 years later into a world in ruins. He promptly encounters an android, [[Yuugure (Towa No Yuugure)|Yuugure]], who asks him to marry her on the spot, and who happens to resemble his long-gone girlfriend.

h4.Characters
* [[Amoru (Towa no Yuugure)|]]
* [[Himegami Akira]]
* [[Oumaki Towasa]]
* [[Yuugure (Towa no Yuugure)|]]
